Play proceeds until resources (the main deck of cards) have been exhausted. The player with the most victory points is the winner.

115249.name: Robokill
115249.description:
User Summary

Titan Prime has been overrun by hostile robots. Go room to room clearing them out in this overhead shooter. Upgrade weapons and utility slots. Gain levels. When you die it will cost you money, and robots will recover some of the rooms you cleared.

115251.description:
Objective: gain 8 (knowledge) chips, acquired by successful answered questions
- acting by turn -
each player moves according rolled die - drawing a question card due to space landed on - correct answer (multiple chice - 1 out of 4) get a chip
landing on an image get 2 chips;
if the answer was wrong you are going to loose chips
content: 55 question cards (all about circus), board, 6 meeples, 1 d6 die, 48 knowlegde-chips, a 30 min DVD movie about the circus, rules
Remarks:
Game belongs to the Noris-series
'Wer-Wie-Was-Warum+Wo?' ==> other games with very similar approach:
'Krankenhaus, Reiterhof, Zoo',
series previously named 'Sehen-Spielen-Lernen'
Each game comes with a DVD which should be viewed before playing the game
115251.name: Der Zirkus

115252.name: Judge Dredd vs Zombies
115252.description:
YOU are the Law!

In Judge Dredd vs. Zombies you take control of the most famous Judge of all time to protect Mega-City One from a zombie invasion!

Empowered to arrest, judge and execute, Judge Dredd is the Law. Arm yourself with an arsenal of deadly weapons and combat hoardes of deadly zombies in thirty levels of game play.

Ensure your Law meter is kept to maximum at all times by eliminating zombies, collecting shields and avoiding damage. When the going gets tough, upgrade your Lawgiver or try the Spitgun, Scattergun or Hi-Ex Launcher. Immerse yourself in a future world where the extreme is the norm!

Source: The Developer Website.

115253.name: Robokill Trainer
115253.description:
User Summary

A demo game of Robokill. Less content available, but same gameplay. An overhead shooter, clear each room to reach the next. Purchase weapon upgrades and shield boosters.

115254.name: Text Express
115254.description:
Welcome aboard the Text Express! Keep your train moving by making words with the letters. Try to reach the next station before the competitor does.

Source: The Game Website.

115255.name: Robot Jim!
115255.description:
User Summary

Just another day at work, until your boss calls you over the intercom. The space station is being attacked and the boss needs you and your gun. Shoot aliens, jump, gather health power ups.

115256.name: Text Express 2
115256.description:
Welcome aboard the Text Express 2! A new journey and a new word adventure. Keep your train moving by making words with the letters.

Source: The Game Website.

115257.name: Top Players' Tennis
115257.description:
Top Players' Tennis (called World Super Tennis (ワールドスーパーテニス) in Japan and Four Players' Tennis in Europe) is a tennis video game for the NES.

The player is given the choice to compete in the four Grand Slams: the Australian Open, the French Open, Wimbledon, and the US Open. To compete in the Grand Slams, the player must first win the qualifying tournament, the Asmik Open.

The game prominently features tennis champions Chris Evert and Ivan Lendl, both of whom are former ATP number 1 ranked singles players.

With a multiplayer console accessory such as the NES Satellite or NES Four Score, Top Players' Tennis accommodates up to four simultaneous players.

Source: Wikipedia, "Top Players' Tennis", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115259.name: Fisher-Price: I Can Remember
115259.description:
User Summary

Fisher-Price: I Can Remember is an educational puzzle game from the early 90s. It is essentially a version of of the classic game `memory.' It is one of seven video games to bear the Fisher-Price brand name (published in the late 80s/early 90s by GameTek/IJE). The game has three difficulty levels and can be played alone, against the computer, or a against a second human player.

115260.name: Penguin Puzzle
115260.description:
Penguin Puzzle is a lovingly crafted puzzle game with great gameplay and a unique look and sound. The game is set on the North Pole, where a freezing blizzard has caused lots of creatures to be frozen in ice cubes. Your goal is to release them. With a cast of penguins, polar bears, seals, birds, Eskimos and others, there's never a dull moment. Penguin Puzzle is one of those games that are easy to pick up, but hard to put down. It's got excellent graphics, sound and music. The bonus levels are lots of fun, they're like an extra game within the game! Everyone has a different playing style, so Penguin Puzzle lets you play a relaxed puzzle game without pressure, or a challenging brain-cruncher - or something in-between.

Source: The Game Website.

115261.name: Gold Rush (2005)
115261.description:
Strike it rich with this exciting puzzler! Jack the Digger needs your help clearing rumble so he can find the mother lode! Tools and special items are at the ready, but it's going to take quick wits to unearth this treasure. Search for golden blocks in "Dig for Gold" mode, or see how far you can go in "Deeper and Deeper". Featuring classic puzzle action, beautiful graphics and tons of surprises to uncover, Gold Rush will have the whole family shouting, "Eureka"!

Source: The Game Website.

115262.name: Earthrise
115262.description:
Earthrise is a science fiction Player vs Player MMORPG by the independent Bulgarian team Masthead Studios released on February 2011.Iit is Masthead's first video game.

The game takes place in a post-apocalyptic setting where the surviving population of the Earth has built a new society ruled by a totalitarian government while armed factions fight for resources and power within the new system. Among other features, a few of note are a skill-based advancement system, a player-driven economy and an emphasis on free PvP. The game uses the Earthrise Engine, an engine that will be used for Masthead's upcoming Fallout Online.

Source: Wikipedia, "Earthrise (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115263.name: The Legend of Prince Valiant
115263.description:
In 1992, King Features developed video game versions of the The Legend of Prince Valiant television series for Nintendo Entertainment System and Game Boy, only in Europe. This fighter/action game, published by Ocean, tells the story of Valiant's search for Camelot at the beginning of season one. The player controls Valiant, enabling him to walk, jump, and throw things at opponents. Typical obstacles are pit traps, water hazards and Archers embedded in the background who shoot like turrets from a stationary position.

Source: Wikipedia, "Legend of Prince Valiant", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115264.description:
(from Compass games website :)

The Battle of Medina de Rioseco, 14 July 1808, was fought during Napoleon’s War in Spain between two Spanish Armies under the commands of General Joaquín Blake and General Gregorio García de la Cuesta, and Marshal Jean-Baptiste Bessières in which the Spanish force was defeated after a closely fought, but determined assault by the French.

Medina de Rioseco was the sole French triumph in the initial invasion of Spain, which failed to seize the country, ultimately requiring a fresh campaign by the Grand Armée under the command of Napoleon himself to (temporarily) secure Spain.

Medina de Rioseco is the fifth game in the Eagles of the Empire series, and is a stand-alone add-in battle to Spanish Eagles (Talavera, 27th and 28th of July 1809, and Albuera, 16th of May 1811.) and is completely playable by itself. Medina de Rioseco features both a historical and alternative battle that allows players to recreate the engagement as it was fought or to bring in additional Spanish forces available but not present at the battle.
115264.name: Medina de Rioseco

115266.name: Rocket Santa
115266.description:
User Summary

The year is 2019. The alien wars continue on the moon. But it's Christmas time, and Santa wants our boys to enjoy the holiday. A launcher game, you must launch as high as possible, eventually to the moon. Buy Santa upgrades to his suit, cannon, jet pack and booster. Increase the frequency of helpful items. Grab the space bucks on the way to buy more upgrades.

115267.name: Run Soldier Run
115267.description:
User Summary

War is hell. Control a platoon making a break for it as artillery rains down from above. Run left or right and if you have multiple troops you can increase or decrease their distance from one another. Gather new troops as you go. The longer one soldier lives the more you score.

115268.name: Brainless Zombie Quiz
115268.description:
User Summary

Brainless Zombie Quiz is a brain teaser game, you have to test yourself with silly questions and amazing funny answers.

115269.name: TipTop
115269.description:
Match and clear the blocks! Use magnets, bombs and other specials to score crazy combos, but don't break the bank!

Source: The Game Website.

115270.name: Sandcastle
115270.description:
User Summary

Your kingdom is under attack. Control the defense systems. You have multiple types of artillery at your disposal: rocks, pencils, banana rockets, pebbles, tennis balls and soap. Rocks are free, the rest must be purchased individually. Aim carefully to destroy the oncoming fleet.

Some sites hosting this game title it "Sandcastle: Defense".

115271.name: Sandcastle - Ancient Invasion
115271.description:
User Summary

The kingdom is under attack and you must defend it. This game features ships from an earlier era, but your weapons are still goofball. This game differs in cleaner, smoother graphics, and the weapons must be upgraded individually to have access to them rather than ammunition being simply purchased.

115272.description:
Lassos & Longhorns is a cooperative dice game where players work together to drive a herd of cattle north to the rail station. By balancing the speed at which they travel, the weight of the herd, and the health of the cowboys, players race competitors to be the first to Wayward Falls to sell their cattle for the highest price. But Butch Montgomery's gang of cattle rustlers, as well as the terrain, weather, and wild animals, aren't going to make it easy for them.

Lassos & Longhorns uses simple, push-your-luck mechanics, to allow for one to four players to work together on the cattle drive. The game is free to download over on the Corvid Games website.
115272.name: Lassos & Longhorns

115273.name: Doodle Block 2G
115273.description:
User Summary

Doodle Block 2G is a physics puzzle game.
You can put your blocks anywhere but if they fall you have failed. The game has more than 100 different blocks, 96 levels and 4 games modes

115274.name: Santastic Santa!
115274.description:
User Summary

Control Santa. Jump to the ledges, destroy block, avoid enemies. When falling down a pit, rather than dying you shift the top of the screen. Dash, jump and move left and right. Once past a part of the screen you cannot retreat.

115275.name: Dots & Boxes
115275.description:
"Starting with an empty grid of dots, players take turns, adding a single horizontal or vertical line between two unjoined adjacent dots. A player who completes the fourth side of a 1×1 box earns one point and takes another turn. (The points are typically recorded by placing in the box an identifying mark of the player, such as an initial). The game ends when no more lines can be placed. The winner of the game is the player with the most points."

Source: Wikipedia, "Dots & Boxes", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115276.name: Horror Racing
115276.description:
User Summary

A racing game that has it all, gorgeous graphics, explosive weapons, upgradeable cars. It{s a race but to win you have to survive.

115277.name: IAmDungeon
115277.description:
"IAMDUNGEON is a game of survival loosely designed around the classic game of minesweeper. Your objective is to delve as deep into the dungeon as possible in search of gold and loot.

Source: The Developer Website.

115278.name: Save The Fallen
115278.description:
User Summary

Collect the fallen soldiers on the battlefield and return them to the tent. Avoid mines, bombs, missiles, artillery, zombies and other obstacles. Upgrade your weapons, teleporter, health and other attributes.

115279.name: iCarus
115279.description:
User Summary

iCarus is a highly stylized game. A man has lost his son and it's up to you to solve the puzzles. The graphics are sketched out as line drawings.

115280.name: Mines
115280.description:
User Summary

Mines is a redevelopment of the classic minesweeper games, now for the Iphone and Ipad.

115281.name: School Invaders
115281.description:
User Summary

A group of rude aliens have invaded your school and you must save the schoolchildren. 3/4 overhead view, mouse to select location, to run towards, space bar fires weapon. Aliens can appear at any moment.

115282.name: Robot 99
115282.description:
"Robots live up in the clouds. Sometimes they might miss a step and accidentally fall down from the sky. The player's goal is to rescue as many robots as possible and help them fly back home. Just tap a robot to open its parachute, then drag and launch it back out into the sky. Tap on a robot quickly to get an extra bonus points. But be careful not to let them collide with each other and make sure to keep their parachute safe from tear. You can also drag the robots to POWERIZONA for better speed and an even higher score."

Source: The Developer Website.

115283.name: Shape It * Connect & Make
115283.description:
User Summary

The goal in Shape It * Connect & Make is to connect all the limes of the same color, the higher the number you connect the higher the bonus you ern,

115284.name: Snowboard Commando
115284.description:
User Summary

In Snowboard Commando you are the only survivor of your squad, you have to save the world from destruction traveling to many countries armed only with a machine gun and your trusty snowboard.

115285.name: Space Freight
115285.description:
"Space Freight throws players into the shoes of a galactic navigator as they attempt to help their mother-ship – the Galactic Explorer SV-3 – reach as many new and exotic planets as possible before it runs out of energy.

To succeed in their quest of exploration for as long as possible users need to direct numerous cargo ships at once towards the Galactic Explorer SV-3 all while keeping a keen eye out for – and battling – dangerous alien enemies who attempt to thwart them in their progress. To ensure gameplay stays varied throughout Space Freight includes five unique cargo ships for players to direct each of which offers users diverse benefits and challenges. Furthermore the game includes three unique alien enemies for players to battle as they fly from one planet to the next, inching ever deeper into the cosmos.

There’s no shortage of motivations and inter-personal competition in Space Freight as well. The game is integrated via Apple’s Game Center as well as OpenFeint, which provides interactive online leaderboards where players from across the globe can compete for high scores and see who is able to guide their mother-ship the furthest. Space Freight also features unlockable online achievements to reward committed players and motivate them to be the best space freight navigators they can be."

Source: The Developer Website.

115286.name: Spectral Magic
115286.description:
User summary

A playtest of the Spectral Sorcerer covering the heroic tier (levels 1-10).

115287.name: Tap Tap Radiation
115287.description:
"Tapulous, maker of the wildly popular iPhone and iPod touch music game Tap Tap Revenge and its newest music franchise Riddim Ribbon, releases Tap Tap Radiation, a brand new, FREE music game available exclusively for the Apple iPad.

Tap Tap Radiation features the high quality gameplay that Tap Tap Revenge players have come to expect. The vast screen size of the iPad is a killer canvas for Tapulous' eye-popping graphics. Designed specifically for the iPad platform, Tap Tap Radiation takes users on a visual ride alongside the beats of each track. The game also features a Freestyle mode that allows users enjoy the music and visuals in a non-competitive environment."

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Origins Awards Best Traditional Card Game Nominee
115288.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Just when you thought it was safe to pick up the controller...just when it seemed the time for cardboard tubes was at an end...the dread elder god Cthulhu rises from his slumber in the sunken city of R'lyeh, and he's not playing games!

Penny Arcade: The Game - Rumble in R'lyeh is both a complete game and an expansion to Penny Arcade: The Game - Gamers vs. Evil. Players can mix the two sets together for the ultimate crazy ride through the sublimely bizarre world of the Penny Arcade web comic. Explore Gabe's Gross Mouth, harness the dubious power of Bono Trask: Timesqueezer, and fall under the curse of TouchWeiners' dark double: the Were-Swan.

So what's new under the sea? Gold cards! These powerful cards require both Tokens and Power to acquire and count as both Green and Red cards, unlocking tons of new synergy and customization options with the previous set. New Green and Red cards add even more longevity to the game.

Integrates with:

Penny Arcade: The Game – Gamers vs. Evil
115288.name: Penny Arcade: The Game – Rumble in R'lyeh
boardgamepodcastepisode: OBG 83: Take Me Out to the Con Game

115289.name: Sci-Fighters
115289.description:
User Summary

Four fighters enter a ring, only one can win! Avoid the large monster, whoever is standing last wins the round. Various power ups will appear including a freeze gun to prevent opponents from moving, super strength to toss opponents at the monster and a monster potion to turn into a monster yourself (still vulnerable to larger monster). Play against a friend on same keyboard.

115290.name: Binga 2
115290.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

Description

Just when your finger has finally healed, Binga is back to break it once again!
Binga 2 is a variety puzzle game that might drive you a little nuts. Use you wits and mouse skills to pass each level and make it on the leader-board.

115291.name: Scorched Sky
115291.description:
User Summary

An overhead shooter. Pick up keys, extra weapons and hopefully some ammo. You can see your opponents line of site by aiming at them. You can engage them, or use stealth. Use Plasma Gun, Pistol, Shotgun or Assault Rifle. Every weapons but pistol must be found during gameplay. There are also dangerous areas that must be avoided. You have a ki detector to help spot those.

115292.name: Knightfall
115292.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

Through 5 scenarios, the Knight seeks his stolen love, imprisoned by the Devil himself. Showcasing a new spin (literally) on the puzzle RPG genre, you must guide your Knight to each level's exit by drilling away the blocks he stands on, and letting gravity take effect! By rotating the entire game board, you can guide him anywhere you wish; into confrontations with the monsters that dwell in the dungeons, or to greedily grab the treasures that litter the game - be careful not to run out of stamina, though! Collect enough currency, and you can buy potions, spells, armour and other trinkets from a shop staffed by a helpful fairy.

3 skill levels cater for absolute beginners, right up to the most hardened strategy fan, 2 different game modes provide essential replayability and a host of achievements await the completist!

Can you save the princess armed with nothing more than a rusting medieval drill and a sense of derring-do?

115293.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Fortress America, the United States must defend itself from three deadly invading armies: the Asian People's Alliance from the West, the Central American Federation from the South, and the Euro-Socialist Pact from the East. Players take on either the role of the United States, struggling to protect itself from foreign threat, or the role of one or more of the invading armies, fighting battle after battle to acquire important territories.

If the invading forces claim enough U.S. cities, America's defense is broken and the nation falls. But if the United States can protect its cities for long enough, the invading forces fail to uproot America and their incursion is ended.

Fortress America is played over several rounds in which each player musters his forces, moves into enemy-controlled territories, and engages in fierce firefights. But depending on whether you're the U.S. player or one of the Invaders, your play experience and general strategy will be entirely different. The U.S. must efficiently wield its colossal lasers, the ultimate weapons of mass destruction, in its own defense. What's more, as U.S. hovertanks, helicopters, bombers, and infantry are destroyed and removed from the map, a steady supply of American guerilla fighters spring up to defend their homeland. The U.S. player is surrounded and alone, and must do his best to fend off advances on three fronts in a series of tense battles.

The Invaders, on the other hand, must remain constantly aggressive. Their objective is to collectively capture 18 of 30 major U.S. cities, and to do so, they must apply early pressure before the U.S. has a chance to react, and keep the pressure constant. To complicate the Invaders' mission, their armies do not receive additional reinforcements, so they must make optimal use of the forces at their disposal. Through a series of nail-biting battles that use a unique dice-based combat system, each player will maneuver his dwindling armies to secure his objective. But can America be stopped, or will a failed invasion only compel them to tighten their military grip on the world.

Changed in this edition:


Custom combat dice, debatable if better than normal dice.
A ten-turn timer gives the U.S. player an additional path to victory: outlasting the invasion.
A "Captured City" track lets all players see, at a quick glance, how close they are to victory or defeat.
A few city locations have been removed, and others added, to create a different (possibly more balanced) play experience.
A deck of variant cards for the Invader players has been added to use as a rules option (equal to 1-2 balance levels).


Reimplements:

Fortress America (1986)
115293.name: Fortress America

115294.name: Serious Santa
115294.description:
User Summary

It is the month after Christmas, and Santa is busy sleeping. Goblins break into Santas workshop, kidnap the elves and begin making dangerous toys. Santa awakes and is none too happy. Find various weapon power ups, jump shoot and run your way through the levels. Features a somewhat interactive environment, environment can be damaged by some weapons and events.

115295.name: Super GameHouse Solitaire
115295.description:
There's nothing better than whiling away the workday playing solitaire on your PC, and this is the perfect new collection to drive your boss nuts. 10 Great Solitaire games in one perfect package, plus lots of great features to make a good thing better.

Super GameHouse Solitaire includes favorites such as:

Klondike
Golf
Addiction
Tri-Peaks
Free Cell
Pyramid
Turbo Solitaire
Crescent
Yukon
Vegas Solitaire"

Source: The Game Website.

115296.name: Ultraball
115296.description:
Ricochet off bumpers, rotate spinners, and earn multi-balls in this fast-moving combination of breakout and pinball games. Master 100 adrenaline-filled levels and four difficulty settings in this new take on the classic Arkanoyd.

Source: The Game Website.

115297.name: Super GameHouse Solitaire Volume 2
115297.description:
Thanks to amazing advances in technology you can now sneak in a solitaire game, right on your PC, the minute your boss turns around. Volume 2 of this series brings you an amazing collection of even more challenging games. What are you waiting for? No one's looking. 

Source: The Game Website.

115298.name: Super GameHouse Solitaire Volume 3
115298.description:
They've done it again! The maniacal minds at GameHouse have sifted through hundreds of card games and found 10 more fantastic Solitaire games! Whether you like the challenge of Scorpion or just a relaxing game of Concentration, you'll love these new single-player card games. Perfect for forgetting the troubles of the day, or sneaking in a quick game on the side

Source: The Game Website.

115299.name: Super Blackjack
115299.description:
Hit, Double Down, Split, and Stand! All the glitz, glamour and fun of the Vegas strip is right on your desktop. For the weekenders, there's the Barroom where there's only one deck and the stakes are lower. Or, cruise over to Vegas where up to 6 decks and high stakes can send your winnings to the moon! Super Blackjack is the perfect, no-risk, way to fun. Hit Me!

Source: The Game Website.

115300.name: Shadow Snake
115300.description:
User Summary

Control a snake who wants to escape the temple of shadows. Avoid the demons, and gather orbs. Once you have gathered enough orbs, the portal to leave the level opens. Defeat a level without damage for a flawless ranking.

115301.name: Super 5-Line Slots
115301.description:
Choose how much you want to bet and pull the arm. Note: The more you bet, the more you can win. Remember, this is for fun only, so no cash awards.

Source: The Game Website.

115302.name: Golf Adventure Galaxy
115302.description:
Your mission: To boldly go where no golfer has gone before! Strange and beautiful 3D worlds await as your adventure unfolds, and your only weapons are your swing and a little white ball. Think of your local mini-golf course, if it were built by an alien race and set in deep outer space.

Source: The Game Website.

115303.name: Zor Draxtau (Issue 2 - Aug 2010)
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
115303.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue:

The Giant Frost Frog; amphian that loves the frozen waste. OGC.
The Bone Hound; a new type of animated construct; a golem poochie. OGC.
The Ice Golem; an icy answer to Frankstein's monster. OGC.
UA Setting Scriptorium; setting considerations for standard First Edition and OSRIC PC classes.




Greetings gamers. Zor Draxtau is the periodic newsletter of the Usherwood Adventures campaign setting that highlights changes and updates to the campaign setting, OGC content otherwise only available in one of the adventures, special newsletter-only discounts on UA swag and POD products, editorials, and short articles of miscellaneous First Edition/OSRIC interest.

115304.name: Piro
115304.description:
"Humanity, since its beginning, admires the restless beauty of fire. It's hard to say if this fascination comes from its light, its heat or from the fear of its destructive power."

"In Piro, players are stimulated to reflect about the dificulty of controlling the fire and will discover why it is called the most rebellious of the four elements."

"The conflagration has just begun... and you with your own hands have it under control!"

"The goal: Every player must spread the fire through the most number of circles on the board. A circle is said "aflame" when it contains exactly one piece of each color (1 red, 1 yellow and 1 orange) or 3 of the same kind (e.g. 3 yellow pieces). Players receive points for completing this task and the winner is the player who first reaches 25 points!"

115305.name: Shadow Snake 2
115305.description:
User Summary

Control a snake, avoid the demons. There are a few differences between this and Shadow Snake. You can eat your own tail, which encourages more graceful movement. Your snake lengthens with each sun chip eaten, making things more difficult. The levels are set up so after beating one level you go to the next, rather than each level being independent. There are upgrades available such as leaving sun chips behind after damaged, being able to free hits and gaining energy from sun chips. The game rates your performance, so you can attempt to beat previous records.

115306.name: 8-bit Inc
115306.description:
In the 80’s, a game company called Tendino created a revolutionary game console called Tendino Entertainment System (TES). Your company, 8-bit Inc, is one of the many companies trying to make the best games for the system and compete with them in the Game Prix Award (GPA).

This is a solo game where the player becomes the manager of 8-bit Inc. The player's job is to manage workers to create game points in graphics, sound, and programming by distributing 3 rolled dice (3D6) on workers. The more dice the player puts into a worker the more game points he will create and the better the game will become. Some workers are better than others.

The player also manages money and hires more workers by using the rolled dice. At the end of summer, the player must pay the workers wages (or lose them) and must compete in the Game Prix Award against other companies.

115307.name: Tune Up
115307.description:
Tune Up, "where you are the mechanic," published by Total Source Parts and Accessories,

For ages 6 and up, 1 or more "mechanics." It plays like the classic game OPERATION, but instead of a human patient, you're working on a cartoonish forklift, dealing with items like an empty tank, sparkless plug, squeaky wheel, sore bottom, kinked hose, etc., that need to be replaced with a TotalSource replacement part.

115308.name: Druid: Daemons of the Mind
115308.description:
Back of the box

Immerse yourself in a strange culture full of mystery, magic, and deception. All is not what it seems in this bizarre and alien world. Who is friend . . . who is foe? What has happened to the missing Druid? What are the strange scientists doing? Which patch is safe to choose? Find your answers by exploring this "feature length" story in a three dimensional world.

- Over 100 fully rendered 3D locations to explore.
- Seamless animations of creatures and characters.
- Carefully crafted detailed story full of twists and turns.
- Over 10,000 frames of animation.
- Rich musical score, sound effects, and digitized speech.
- Ready-made single character party
- Action-based combat system
- Intuitive point-and-click interface
- Isometric overhead view of a 3D world.

115309.name: Jig-Words
115309.description:
A word game. The pieces have both letters and black squares on them. The objective is to use all your tiles by making a correct Crossword. The player wins if he has used his last tile.

It can be played as a puzzle or it can be played competitively.

The box claims:
A Boon to the Sick
Days of Amusement
Entirely New and Novel
A 'Service' Favourite
186 tiles

The 'Service' reference probably means the game was published within the years 1939 to 1945 (World War II).

115310.name: Total Pinball 3D
115310.description:
User Summary

Total Pinball 3D is a successor to Pinball Mania: Kick Off. It has 4 tables, each with their own themes.

Players can customize the table tilt, the number of balls per game, and how many balls are permitted for multiball.

115311.name: Dragonflight
115311.description:
Back of the box

Thalion Software brings you DRAGONFLIGHT - an absorbing role playing game in the traditional sense. It includes all the traditional elements of role playing games but has real game depth, atmospheric sound throughout, and stunning graphics.

Dragonflight features include:
- Easy yet extensive user interface
- 10 dungeons with up to 14 levels in first-person perspective
- Enormous detailed fantasy world map with:
- 12 cities and villages
- fighting screens with detailed animations of all characters and monsters
- movie-like animated sequences
- more than 150 usable items, including weapons, potions, spells, clothes, and scrolls
- extensive magic system
- full fantasy fiction novella beautifully illustrated
- 2.5 megabyte of data packed on two disks.

115312.name: Venus: The Flytrap
115312.description:
User Summary

Venus: The Flytrap is a post-apocalyptic game where you control a robotic fly sent out to clean up the pollution covering the planet. You travel through 8 worlds, fighting mutated creatures and plants.

Most enemies, when defeated, release a powerup that can upgrade your fly's abilities. Some powerups, however, are traps that can harm you, such as reversing your controls.

115313.description:
An expansion for Heroes of the Blitzkrieg.

In Defeat, Defiance brings the British Expeditionary Force to the battlefield of France 1940. An expansion to the hugely popular Heroes of the Blitzkrieg, In Defeat, Defiance is the biggest British expansion ever. Included are over 170 counters, and fourteen intriguing scenarios.

The 170 counters include Vickers, Cruiser, and Matilda tanks, Bren carriers, 2pdr and 25mm Anti-tank guns, 51mm mortars, Leaders, heroes, snipers, Squads, Bren guns, Boys Anti-tank rifles, and much more. The fourteen scenarios, all designed by Dale Holmstrom (The Swift and the Bold) and Mark Walker, cover everything from British and SS fighting near Arras to Rommel crossing the Brasse Canal."

This game is no longer available and you can find the new, improved and expanded edition in Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes in Defiance
115313.name: Lock ‘n Load: In Defeat, Defiance

115314.name: Gruesome
115314.description:
Gruesome is a game in which you play the grue, hunting adventurers to eat in dark caves whilst avoiding the painful light of their torches.

Source: The Game Website.

115315.name: Toby the Trapper
115315.description:
Toby the Trapper is a roguelike in which you can only harm enemies with traps you lay. Control the fast-moving Toby to outwit the smelly ogres and the unique bosses, before taking on the evil might of Wuggy the Warlock. It was made for the Seven Day Roguelike Challenge 2010, but has received some updates since.

Source: The Game Website.

115316.name: UNSTOPPABLE
115316.description:
When an unstoppable force meets an indestructible object... You are a robot with impenetrable armour, and you wield a gun that fires bullets which cannot be stopped. You fight lesser robots on a looping map – the only danger is yourself as the map becomes ever more filled with your unstoppable shots. Clear each level of its robotic denizens before moving to the next, and eventually face up against the lethal Rogue AI.

Source: The Game Website.

115317.name: Broken Bottle
115317.description:
Broken Bottle is a grim tale of alcoholism and brutality in a post-apocalyptic world. It was written for the Seven Day Roguelike Challenge 2011, but has been updated a little since. The game is mostly story-focused, following an alcoholic as he tries to find the surface following a nuclear war. Alcohol also plays an important part in several game dynamics.

Source: The Game Website.

115318.name: Joe Danger 2: The Movie
115318.description:
"Joe Danger: The Movie is an upcoming racing/platform video game and the second title of British independent developer Hello Games. According to Hello's managing director, it is "kind of" a sequel to the successful PlayStation Network title Joe Danger. The game was announced in August 2011, and is estimated to be released in early 2012.

Joe has gained favor with a movie director in Hollywood and is brought on to perform all the stunts on set. The movie consists entirely of cliche action stunts and so he must perform chase scenes on mini carts, skis, and police bikes."

Source: Wikipedia, "Joe Danger: The Movie", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115319.name: Ninja Gaiden 3
115319.description:
Ninja Gaiden 3 is an action-adventure video game developed by Team Ninja and published by Tecmo Koei.

The game is the first in the modern series to be directed by someone other than Tomonobu Itagaki, the former franchise director. In his place is Yosuke Hayashi, the creator of the Sigma remakes.

The game explores Ryu Hayabusa's more human side as he descends into a hellish realm. The history involving the Fiends and Archfiends from the previous titles is not explored this time around, and instead involves a mysterious cult of alchemists seeking to destroy the world as we know it and create a new world order, with Ryu as the catalyst.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ninja Gaiden 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115320.name: Sportmagazin Kicker  Champions Quiz
115320.description:
Objective:
collect 5 chips before you are allowed answering the final questions
- acting by turn -
determine difficulty level first
level one: give 1 correct answer for 1 question (5 times out of 5 different terms); level two: 2 correct answers for 2 questions ...; level three: 3 correct answers...
roll the die, move your meeple, draw appropiate (colour) question or event card, follow instructions if you land on a space with a symbol.. if you had bad luck even back to starting point.
As soon as you've acquired 5 chips reaching target spaces you are protected - now you only have to find the correct answer(s) for the final question(s)

115321.description:
"Hoops of Fire" is a print-and-play* two-player card game in which you coach a basketball team. The goal is for the game to be enjoyable both for basketball junkies who are new to card/board games, and for gamers who have little idea about basketball.

Draft your players and defensive strategy, then control the line-up throughout the game as exhaustion and fouls pile up. Stick to the shots that your star players are most comfortable with, or set up a pick and roll to see how the defense reacts. Finally, steal an unlikely away victory with that buzzer beater!

Example of play video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nmLNsrNt4ts

* - that being said, Quique (oladola) developed a beautiful Tabletop Simulator module (http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=493360...;searchtext=hoops+on+fire - let us know in case you'd like to try it out), while Pedro (torontoraptors) is currently working hard on an Android app!
115321.name: Hoops on Fire

115322.name: Eesti Jalgpall
115322.description:
The game where is mixed football, dice rolling and trivia.
There are 10 footballers and 1 goalkeeper on the big game board for both players. Player rolls 4 dice on his turn. He may move his footballers as many squares indicated on 2 usual dice.
There are yellow or red card on one side of the 2 other dice.
If yellow card is rolled player's opponent draws yellow card and asks a question about Estonian football (soccer). If current player answers correctly he may continue his turn.
If he answers uncorrectly he misses the turn.
If red card is rolled player must remove one of his footballer from the game.

Player who scores most at the end of the game hitting the goals is the winner.

From the publisher:
This is a dice game, that combines trivia, football (not American "football") and dice luck.
Game goes by the rules of football and also gives advantage to the player who has more knowledge about Estonian national football team.
Each player tries to score goals, by going by the game board instructions, while each correct answer will give you another chance to hit a goal.

115323.description:
The unicorns from all over the world organize a competition flight.
Player with his unicorn has 2 options: move forward 1 space on the game board or risk and roll 6 dice with combination of courage, foresight and luck. If he lucky he may move more than 1 space or sometimes needs to reset his character this turn. Who plays and sent at the end arrives first, wins.
115323.name: Sternenschweif: Flug durch die Nacht

115324.description:
The objective is to locate six items that will enable to transorm Star pony into a unicorn.
49 cards are laid out face down on the game board, and the stall is being prepared. Plyer roll the dice and move either horizontally or vertically and in the target field he may uncover an adjacent tile. Player may continue her turn if she opens an item she doesn't have yet, but if she opens Buddy the dog she loses everything opened this turn.

Who has 6 different items and find also a stall cards may try to open the barn and win the game.
115324.name: Sternenschweif: Zauberhafte Verwandlung

115325.description:
Les Maréchaux (The Marshals) is an operational wargame designated to simulate campaigns led by French marshals and generals of French Revolution and 1st Empire, when Napoleon was not directly acting on the theater of operations.

The game includes two scenarios:
- "Junot 1808" related to general Junot's campaign in Portugal against Wellesley, during summer 1808.
- "Soult 1809" related to marshal Soult's campaign in Portugal against Wellesley, during winter and spring 1809.

Players are moving divisions and brigades on a "point to point" map. They have to deal with supply, forced march and to prepare battles. The leaders of each army have a key role in coordinating actions.

The game includes:
- one A3 map for Soult's campaign;
- one A4 map for Junot's campaign;
- 108 die-cut counters;
- independent rules and scenarios booklet.

Available with French rules, but English rules can be downloaded from Vae Victis or Designer's website.


The second game in the series is Les Maréchaux II: Dupont 1808 – Victor 1811 – Suchet 1813 with three campaigns in Spain.
115325.name: Les Maréchaux: Junot 1808 –  Soult 1809

115326.name: Cardo
115326.description:
Game played with two identical sets of 34 tiles. Each tile is marked with one of the card suits: spades, hearts, diamonds or clubs, plus one of the values from 7 up to ace.

You try to get rid of your tiles in a domino-like manner. In the same suit with a value one higher or lower than the tile next to it. Or in a different suit with the same value. The black and red joker have special rules.

First one to get rid of his tiles wins.

115327.description:
Sheltie and the other ponies escape and the players try to catch them. In order to retrieve as many ponies on the paddock, you need luck, courage and the right spin with the spinner.

The top card is revealed, the player spins the spinner and press down the edge of the roundabout before the roundabout even touched the table. Is the subject form the card is touched the next card is revealed and player may continue her turn but if the sucject is not touched she loses all cards revealed this turn. Sheltie acts as a wildcard.

Player with the most cards revealed = ponies catched at the end of the game is the winner.
115327.name: Sheltie und seine Freunde

115328.name: Magia i Miecz (Issue 3 - 1993)
115328.description:
Table of contents:

Listy
Samotna przygoda
Kryształy Czasu
Warhammer Fantasy Role Play
Klan miłośników gier strategicznych

115329.name: Magia i Miecz (Issue 4 - 1993)
rpgissuearticle: Battletech - Dwugłos na temat nowego produktu Encore

Table of Contents:

Battletech - Dwugłos na temat nowego produktu Encore

115330.name: Going Home
115330.description:
Publisher's blurb:


A game about people who have lost everything and live in filth, finally told they have just one chance to get home – or then next best thing.The theme of this game is obsession. An obsession that drives men to madness and despair, to acts of cruelty and barbarism, for the simplest of things: the chance to go home.

115331.name: Magia i Miecz (Issue 5 - 1993)
115331.description:
Table of contents:

Listy
Recenzje - Artur Marciniak, Tomasz Kołodziejczak
GURPS System Uniwersalny - Dariusz Paszkowski
Kryształy Czasu - Artur Szyndler

Bardzo cenny pierścień - Tomasz Kołodziejczak

115332.name: Magia i Miecz (Issue 6 - Jan 1994)
115332.description:
Table of contents:

Listy
Kluby

Rycerz - Robert Zegar
Czy Wikingowie mieli rogi? - Artur Szrejter

Pułapki w pułapkach - Artur Marciniak
Gdy wojna zapuka do drzwi
Klan miłośników gier strategicznych

115333.name: Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Bestiary Box
rpghonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best RPG Supplement Nominee
115333.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The brutal beasts of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Bestiary come alive on your tabletop with this box-busting collection of more than 300 creature pawns for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or any tabletop fantasy RPG! Printed on sturdy cardstock, each pawn contains a beautiful full-color image of a nasty monster from the core Pathinder RPG monster reference. Each cardstock pawn slots into a size-appropriate plastic base, making them easy to mix with traditional metal or plastic miniatures. With multiple pawns for commonly encountered creatures and more than 250 distinct creature images, the Bestiary Box is the best way to ensure you've got the right creatures to push your Pathfinder campaign to the next level!

115334.name: The Moonscar
115334.description:
From the back of the book:

Demons in Space

For millennia, a complex plot has brewed in a demonic jungle on the surface of the moon—a plan by the patient and sinister succubi of the Moonscar to kidnap and brainwash the people of Golarion. Now a long-dormant portal linking the moon to Golarion has returned to life, accelerating the demon queen’s designs. Only the brave PCs can venture to the surface of the moon, navigate the treacherous Abyssal jungle called the Moonscar, and delve into the depths of the Insatiable Queen’s subterranean palace of torture, seduction, and depravity. Can the heroes rescue the kidnapped people of Golarion and return them to their positions of power and prominence, or is it too late for the unfortunate victims of the demon queen of the moon?

The Moonscar is an adventure of extraplanetary exploration for 16th-level characters, written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game and compatible with the 3.5 edition of the world’s oldest RPG. This volume also includes a gazetteer of a wilderness region of Golarion that contains a gate to the moon amid the ruins of an ancient astronomical research station, a detailed dungeon complex beneath the surface of a lunar jungle, and a brand-new space monster, all of which can be easily adapted for use in any campaign setting.

115335.name: The Bechdel Test
115335.description:
User summary:

In this short role-playing poem, players will assume the roles of women - and women only - characters from mainstream movies and role-play a scene in which the women talk together about something other than a man. It's as simple as that, and the whole game takes only ~15 minutes to play.

Publisher's blurb:

This [role-playing poem] takes its name from the Bechdel Test. It's a fun exercise in fleshing out characters, and – hopefully – in creating believable female characters in any medium.

115336.name: Legions Realm Monthly (Issue 4 - Dec 2002)
rpgissuearticle: Adding Dimension to Your Game Night
Jolly R. Blackburn Shares His Wisdom & Experience
New Series, New Book, New Questions
The Story of Yuriel Blackstone Part III
115336.description:
Volume 1 / Issue 4

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

rpgitemversion: Deep Pact: Heroic-Tier Playtest PDF Version
115338.name: The Deep Pact
115338.description:
From the introduction

You have gazed into the abyss and made contact with the deep dwellers, a mysterious force that has granted you the powers of the unfathomable ocean. These dwellers whisper their secrets into your ear, speaking with mouths ringed with uneven teeth and a multitude of tongues, and you use them to bring horror to your enemies.

User summary

A playtest of the Deep Pact Warlock covering the heroic tier (levels 1-10).

115339.name: Abstractables
115339.description:
From Publisher Website:

Abstractables is the fast-paced, creative thinking, word guessing game where you try to get your team to correctly guess a word or phrase by arranging and interacting with simple shapes before the time runs out.

Do you know what a cow looks like? Of course you do, but can you design one with basic shapes? And get your team to guess it correctly? And do it all in 60 seconds while your teammates are screaming hilariously wrong answers at you? Welcome to ABSTRACTABLES!

With 2000 words and phrases from 8 categories, including animals, people, locations, food, sayings, motions, objects and entertainment, the possibilities for fun for the whole family are endless and the replay value incredibly high. You simply roll the die, draw a card, and start moving the pieces. It’s so fun and easy, anyone can play. Bring Abstractables to your next family gathering or game night and watch the hilarity ensue!

It levels the playing field. Not artistic, don't worry, you don't need to draw anything. Just move the pieces to form the shape to communicate the word or phrase to your team.

Abstractables contains 3-layer European Birch hardwood pieces, category cards with over 2000 words or phrases, a one-minute timer, and an 8-sided category die.

115340.name: Legions Realm Monthly (Issue 5 - Jan 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Remember The Old & In With The New
The Story of Yuriel Blackstone Part IV
115340.description:
Volume 2 / Issue 1

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

115341.name: Ranged Barbarian
115341.description:
User summary

A playtest of the Ranged Barbarian build covering the heroic tier (levels 1-10).

115342.name: The Scribe
115342.description:
From the introduction

Scribes are keepers of ancient knowledge and arcane secrets. They use their magic as a tool to bolster their peers with supportive glyphs while keeping enemies at bay with baleful ones. Scribes may have been trained in ivory towers, but on the battlefield they can be devastatingly effective allies.

Your ability to cast these runes can come from a variety of backgrounds and sources. You could be a pious cleric of a monastery just now exploring the world, an educated noble using his knowledge for his subjects’ benefit, an explorer who’s stumbled across ancient words of power, or a chieftain who has inherited the arcane symbols passed down through his tribe. Regardless of how you learned them, your mastery has made you a force to be reckoned with.

You wave your wand not to cast, but to write. You speak words not of prayer, but of potency. For you, knowledge truly is power, and you are eager to teach your enemies just how powerful it can be.

User summary

A playtest of the The Scribe class covering the heroic tier (levels 1-10).

115343.description:
Twelve Days of Christmas is a press-your-luck game based on the classic English Christmas carol.

A player's turn consists of three phases: a card-drawing phase, a set-playing phase, and a gift-giving phase. First you draw one or more cards, and possibly pass them out to other players. Then you must lay down one set of cards. Finally, you give one card as a gift to the player on your right, ending your turn. When 12 “Days of Christmas” cards are showing, the round is over and you all total your scores.

This is an expanded version of the game Stocking Stuffers. http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/15075
115343.name: Twelve Days of Christmas

115344.name: Feed The Animals
115344.description: Simple spin and move game from the mid-1950's from the Whitman Company. Object is to feed animals of the game in order to score extra points.

115345.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 6 - Dec 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Battle Report - Warzone - Saving Private Miller
Black and White and Painted all Over
D20 Product Review - Heart of Nightfang Spire
Miniature Review - Wizards of the Coast
Standing Orders - Katana & The Road to Osaka
115345.description:
Cover uncredited

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

115346.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 7 - Mar 2002)
rpgissuearticle: D20 Product Review - The Gryphon's Legacy
Dungeons and Dragons - Battle Magic Spells
Miniature Review - Wizards of the Coast
Standing Orders - Lord of the Rings
115346.description:
Cover uncredited

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

115347.description:
As in the fairy tale the animals must jump on each others’ backs.

Some donkey cards are on the table. Each player receives six cards, which he keeps hidden in his hand. The remaining cards form the draw pile.

In his turn player play a card on the table.
He may play dog sitting on donkey, cat sitting on dog and rooster sitting on cat. Additionally player may play card upon another card with same color
If the player has no matching card, he draws one from the draw pile and his turn is over.

But beware! The rooster will mess up the entire game. If the player has placed a rooster, then he draws a card from the deck and looks out one of the two animals shown. Then the card is placed to the left player and asked if he has the animal in the selected color in his the hand. If no, he takes it to his hand. If Yes the both cards move to next player unitl someone has taken all this cards.

The player who discards the last card must make the sound of one of the animals depicted on the last card.
The winner is the first who plays his last card.
115347.name: Bremer Stadtmusikanten

115348.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 8 - Jun 2002)
rpgissuearticle: D20 Product Review - Prophecies of the Dragon
D20 Product Review - The Hunt - Rise of Evil
Miniature Review - Wizards of the Coast

Cover artwork provided by Mystic Eye Games

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below
