rpgissuearticle: Miniature Review - Holistic Design - Fantasy Encounters
Miniature Review - Wizards of the Coast
115349.description:
Cover uncredited

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

115351.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 10 - Dec 2002)
rpgissuearticle: Battle Report - Chronopia - Firstborn vs Devout
The Slave Pit - Painting Translucent Clothing
115351.description:
Cover by Dave Ross

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

115352.name: Wirbel auf der Weide
115352.description:
Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible (finding fodder on your way back to the shed & getting oat)
- moving by turn -
each player has to move his/her 3 horses back from the pasture to the shed
throw (better: flip) the die inside the cover, that it touches the edge: bouncing back you may move/act with your horse according the space(colour) the die ends up;
make up your mind: choosing a short route you will get less valuable fodder but you are safe (more or less) getting a dry space with oat ==> which is necessary that all the stuff you picked up along your way home does count

115353.name: Anima Tactics: Akio Kageshima
115353.description:
A powerful wizard from Lannet who is in fact, working for the Magus Order. Akio is trying to merge the oriental foundation of magic with the knowledge of the Order to expand his own skills.

Neutral Wanderer Mystic - Lv. 35
At 4 | Dm 2 | Df 8 | Ar 0 | LP: 10 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 2/4
oo - Spiritual Beam (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance Attack (16 inch). +1 Attack / +3 Damage.
oooo - Soul Storm (Magic, Ranged Attack)
Distance Attack (16 inch). +2 Attack / +8 Damage.
oo - Magical Shield (Magic, Defense, Reactive)
Special Dodge. +5 Defense.

115354.name: Anima Tactics: Belith
115354.description:
Former agent of the Order of Yehudah, Bellith is one of the most efficient supernatural freelancer agents in all of Gaïa. Her notable mastery of summoning and binding monsters and demons has made her famous throughout the underworld.

Dark Wanderer Mystic - Lv. 45+
At 4 | Dm 4 | Df 8 | Ar 0 | LP: 11 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Summon Level: 2
Affinity: Dark
Container: The Cost to Summon one of Belith's Summons (chosen when summoned) is reduced by one point. This skill has no effect on Aeons.
ooo - The Death, Reversed (Magic, Effect)
An enemy unit within Belith's Control Zone suffers Doom Lv. 2. Effect 15.
ooo - The Empress, Reversed (Magic, Effect)
An enemy unit within Belith's Control Zone can only use one Action type (chosen by its controller) until the end of the turn. For example, if Dodge is chosen, the enemy unit could not perform Attacks, Charges, or any type of action other than Dodge. Free Actions may be performed normally. Effect 15.
oo - The Devil (Magic, Effect)
Belith gets +2 Attack, +2 Defense, and +2 Damage.
Upkeep: o

115356.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 11 - Mar 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Game Company Interview - Iron Kingdoms - Privateer Press
115356.description:
Cover uncredited

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

115357.name: The Stately Homes of Great Britain
115357.description:
A rare party game from the Goodall company.

Each guest or team receive a card with anagrams of the names of well-known Stately Homes. During the evening the guests can look at the anagrams and work out their answers. When the host calls "Time", the guest or team with the most correct answers, wins.

115358.name: Who Knows?
115358.description:
Party game of trivia questions.

Each guest or team is given a card with 36 questions on it. During the evening they are encouraged to fill in all the correct answers, or just guess the ones they don't know. When the host calls "Time", the guest or team with the most correct answers, wins.

115359.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 12 - Jun 2003)
115359.description:
Cover uncredited

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

115360.name: Baccalite
115360.description:
This is a Roulette related game from around the 1930's by Chad Valley. The game is set inside the box with a metal spinner. All the players except the bank can bet any amount of counters they wish, on any colour they wish. Then you place the ball into the device, and give it a spin, and see where the ball falls out. This lights one of the circles at the side and who ever has bet on that colour wins.

The colours offer the odds as follows:
Green 2 - 1
Yellow 3 - 1
Blue 5 - 1
Pink 7 - 1
Red 15 - 1

You can bet with counters, or real money if everyone agrees. The Bank should be a different person each 'race'.

115363.name: Mon premier jeu de Parcours
115363.description:
A dice game for very young children. Player move animals along a path by rolling a colour dice (moving to the next square of the colour the dice is showing). Special dice envents are the butterfly (move to the same colour you are standing on) and the bug (moving backwards). The winning player of a run gets a chip, then the race starts againg. First player with 3 chips is winner.

"Back of the box" desciption: Little animals are walking along a path. The die shows red! The little dog can move onto the next red square... A game that encourages communication between toddlers and their parents.

115365.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 13 - Sep 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Concept Artwork - Ultimate Warzone and Chronopia
Game Background - Ultimate Warzone and Chronopia
115365.description:
Cover uncredited

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

115366.name: "Blackout"
115366.description:
Educational game recommended for Sunday School teachers to help children with their numbers' recognition.

In a turn, the child spins a number and then reads out the word on their board relating to that number. That word can then be crossed off, i.e. a Blackout counter is put on to it. Play proceeds until one child has crossed off all their words.

The lessons can be graded. Younger children can start with Blue cards, the Yellow can be attempted, then Green, and finally Red. It is suggested that Red is not used until the teacher is sure that the children are ready

115367.name: Tout est bien qui finit bien
115367.description:
40 illustrated cards. The cards are divided into four series designated by different colored borders and by an illustration in the upper left corner of either la Maison, le Chäteau, le Jardin, or le Moulin. Each series is further divided into cards illustrated with the same objects, i.e. a dog, a cat, a key, a door, a banner, a man, a woman, a young boy, and a mousetrap.

The object of the game appears to be to collect all the keys, all the doors, etc by asking other players for the cards you need, in a Quartet or Authors fashion

115368.name: Spin-A-Word
115368.description:
Children's game, aimed at improving their spelling.

In a turn, the player spins the spinner and this will indicate two letters. He writes them down and, if it is the very first turn, he spins again and notes two more letters. If he can now make a word, using the letters, he tells the other players and he scores some points. If he cannot make a word, he passes. When it is his turn again, he spins the spinner but only once now, and gets two more letters. The longer the word, the more points. The first to score 30 points is the winner.

115370.name: Cuttle
115370.description: Cuttle is a two-player card game played with a regular deck of 52 playing cards. The aim of the game is to have at least 21 points worth of number cards on the table. During a turn a player can either take a card from the stock pile, play a card on table or play a card as a one-off effect. Almost all of the different ranks of cards have special effects, such as "remove all number cards from the table", "counter an effect just played", "take any card from the scrap pile", "see your opponents cards" etc. The game is somewhat similar to Magic: the Gathering but likely much older.

115371.name: Shootin' Ladders: Glass of Milk
115371.description:
This is a mini-expansion for Shootin' Ladders. It adds the board hazard 'Glass of Milk'.

From the rules:
It should come as no surprise that milk & cookies are a lethal combination - for cookies, that is. And so, much like Oil Barrels in other shooter games, Glasses of Milk can be used as explosive hazards in SHOOTIN' LADDERS.

This expansion comes on a single 8.5" x 11" glosssy thick sheet of paper. The lower section of the paper is designed to be cut apart giving six different glasses of milk.

115372.name: Despicable Me: The Game
115372.description:
Be Despicable! (It’s fun!) Despicable Me: The Game lets players of all ages experience the thrill of being Gru, one of the world’s greatest supervillains who is planning the biggest heist in history – stealing the moon. Complete heists and missions in a unique blend of action and puzzle solving that combines the fun of commanding minions and using an arsenal of Despicable gadgets and weapons.

Features

-Become Despicable Me’s mastermind Gru as he sets off on a series of incredible heists to obtain components for his awesome rocket
-Command an army of minions to complete puzzles and missions
-Use an arsenal of never-before-seen weapons and gadgets like shrink rays and freeze rays
-Master Air Combat: Fly Gru’s aircraft in daring flight missions against his nemesis, Vector
-Play as Gru or Vector in a variety of multiplayer air combat modes (Wii, PS2)
-Based on Universal Pictures’ new 3-D CGI feature, Despicable Me, in theatres July 9, 2010

Source: The Publisher Website.

115373.name: N.Y. Captor
115373.description:
User Summary

In N.Y. Captor, you shoot bad guys that pop out from various buildings on the screen. Avoid getting shot with your limited movement as you try to kill as many as you can before being taken down.

This game is played with a joystick rather than a lightgun like many of the type.

115374.name: Night Striker
115374.description:
User Summary

Night Striker is variable shooter game. Utilize your joystick to target enemies and progress through levels. the game is variable in that at each level you are given choices as to which way to proceed. Collect life to stay alive while shooting as many baddies as possible.

The joystick used is very similar to the classic Gorf joystick.

115375.name: Nun Chackun
115375.description:
User Summary

Nun Chackun is an 80's ninja fighting game. Traverse levels beating up enemies and bosses to complete levels.

115376.name: Metal Soldier Isaac
115376.description:
User Summary

In Metal Soldier Isaac you play a space ship to destroy endless enemy spaceships while avoiding obstacles and other flying objects. Shoot as many as you can in an attempt to get high score.

115377.name: Metal Soldier Isaac 2
115377.description:
User Summary

Metal Soldier Isaac 2 is the sequel to the first one released in 1984. Fly your spaceship to shoot new enemies in an attempt to save the galaxy.

115378.name: Midnight Landing
115378.description:
User Summary

Midnight Landing is a airline flight simulator from Taito. Featured a very deluxe looking sitdown cabinet and decent simulation controls.

115379.name: Disney Tangled: The Video Game
115379.description:
Join Rapunzel and Flynn on a hair-raising adventure inspired by the new Disney film!

Features

• Experience an action-packed world inspired by the movie
• Swing, twirl, and climb with Rapunzel
• Duel as Flynn and find buried treasure
• Engage in 2-4 player co-op
• Ride horses and navigate through underground caves
• Paint the Tower’s murals and Flynn’s wanted posters
• Explore on your own with the split screen feature
• Use “Hold My Hand” option to guide other players

Source: The Game Website.

115380.name: Mini-Vaders
115380.description:
User Summary

A followup variant on space invaders with varying levels. Some just have one alien then increase level by level. Survive as long as you can.

115381.name: Missile-X
115381.description:
User Summary

Missile-X is one of the first arcade shoot-em-ups. In it, players shoot missles to destroy enemy tanks and collect points. As with most games of the genre and age, the goal is to score as many points as possible and try to get high score.

115382.name: Mission 660
115382.description:
User Summary

Mission 660 is a min 80's taito shoot-em-up in space. Play a ship shooting through various waves of enemies. Find the boss at the end and plug it with gun until it is destroyed and the cycle begins anew. Features very colorful graphics.

115383.name: Disney's Chicken Little: Ace in Action
115383.description:
Blast off with Chicken Little's superhero alter ego, Ace, and te valiant versions of his misfit friends Runt, Abby, and Mr. Fish. Foxy Loxy and her sidekick, Goosey Loosey, are planning a totally terrible takeover of the planet Earth! Will Ace and his squadron prevail? Only if you can hatch an egg-stravagant operation t ooust those pesky alien robots.

Features

- Play as Ace the soldier, Runt the tank commander or Abby the spaceship/hovercraft pilot.

- Take a thrill ride across Pluto, Saturn, Mars, the moon, and various other solar-system outposts, blasting bad guys every rocket burst of the way.

- Use space-age weapons and galactic gadgets to overpower adversaries.

- Battle in tanks and spaceships in the two-player multiplayer mode.

Source: The Publisher Website.

115384.name: Moon Lander
115384.description:
User Summary

In Moon Lander you try to avoid enemies and debris in order to land your spaceship on the planet surface. After landing you must return a rescued astronaut to your ship at the top of the screen.

115385.name: Disney's Chicken Little: Ace in Action (DS)
115385.description:
Blast off with Chicken Little's superhero alter ego, Ace, and te valiant versions of his misfit friends Runt, Abby, and Mr. Fish. Foxy Loxy and her sidekick, Goosey Loosey, are planning a totally terrible takeover of the planet Earth! Will Ace and his squadron prevail? Only if you can hatch an egg-stravagant operation t ooust those pesky alien robots.

Features

- Venture to Venus, the moons of Jupiter, and through a rough-and-tumble asteroid belt.

- Mount interstellar missions with soldier, spaceship, and tank gameplay.

- Employ a stockpile of powerful weapons, including blasters, grenades, rockets, and tank rounds.

- Enhance your skills with out-of-this-world wireless two-player mini-games.

Source: The Publisher Website.

115386.name: Operation Tiger
115386.description:
User Summary

Operation Tiger is a cooperative 2 person light shooter game of the late '90s. Utilize mounted Uzis to shoot enemy soldiers, rescue hostages, steal a helicopter and escape.

115387.name: Doctor Fizzwizzle's Animal Rescue
115387.description:
Why has everyone fled the islands? There's not a person in sight! Who will feed the animals and find out what scared the people way? Doctor Fizzwhizzle, of course!

Bounce bubbles, rescue hungry animals, and solve a mystery all at the same time! Over 180 levels of thrilling brick-bursting action, and over 60 animal species to rescue!

Features

- Over 180 levels of brick-bursting, animal-rescuing mayhem!
- Over 60 adorable animal species to rescue
- Collect coins to help buy food for the animals
- Unlock dozen of Achievements
- Special kids' mode with fun animal quizzes
- Scoring and awesome achievements are automatically tracked

Source: The Publisher Website.

115388.name: Legions Realm Monthly (Issue 6 - Feb 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Using Periodicals to Enhance Your Game Session
115388.description:
Volume 2 / Issue 2

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

115389.name: Don King Boxing
115389.description:
Wii Overview:

2K Sports, in collaboration with legendary promoter Don King, brings you an unprecedented look into the sport of professional boxing. Feel what it's like to be a real PRO boxer in your very own living room with the Wii Balance Board™. Duck and dodge blows and throw counter punches with both hands, all while trying to maintain your center of balance on the Wii Balance Board. Add to that over 20 actual licensed boxers, a deep career mode, and an intuitive multiplayer split screen mode, and you’ve got a gaming experience that immerses players into the sport of boxing like never before.

Nintendo DS Overview:

Created exclusively for the Nintendo DS, gamers will use the stylus pen to jab, hook, uppercut, and even perform combos on the DS touch screen to help your boxer find his opponent’s sweet spot and deliver that KO punch. These unique control and feedback mechanisms in Don King Boxing not only make the player feel like they are truly boxing, ducking and dodging blows, but train the player to become an actual boxer.

Source: The Publisher Website.

115390.name: Legions Realm Monthly (Issue 7 - Mar 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Blast to the Past - A Look at Older Games
115390.description:
The cover is labeled "Volume 2 / Issue 4"

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

115391.name: Legions Realm Monthly (Issue 8 - Apr 2003)
115391.description:
The cover is labeled "Volume 2 / Issue 4"

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

115392.name: Legions Realm Monthly (Issue 9 - May 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Ride with the Riders of the Dead
115392.description:
Volume 2 / Issue 5

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

115393.name: Operation Wolf 3
115393.description:
User Summary
A follow-up to the popular operation wolf. In this version, use your light guns to free hostages in one of three difficulty levels that you choose. Each is far more dangerous than the last. Fight through 5 levels.

115394.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Throughout the "A Tale of Champions" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, unique knights, lords, and ladies have assembled to observe the spectacles of battle and to use such assemblies to further their hidden agendas. Now the inevitable confrontations come to a head in the cycle's final Chapter Pack, A Poisoned Spear!

Its new cards continue to support the melee format's layered alliances and enmities, as well as the new Melee and Joust keywords. New characters, attachments, and a fantastic new location are certain to promote players' appreciation of the most notable and unique characters from George R.R. Martin's A Song of Ice and Fire.
115394.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – A Poisoned Spear
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire

115395.name: Legions Realm Monthly (Issue 10 - Jun 2003)
rpgissuearticle: SJ Games Aid In U.S. Troop Morale
115395.description:
Volume 2 / Issue 6

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

115396.name: Dood's Big Adventure
115396.description:
Welcome to Dood’s Big Adventure!
Using the power of the uDraw GameTablet you can draw, tilt and maneuver your way through 60 different challenging levels. Customize your own Dood to roll, float, and bounce through challenges by solving drawing related puzzles, collecting coins and defeating enemies, all in a world customized by you!

Game Modes:

- Pen Panic: Draw a line through Dood and create a trampoline to bounce him through the levels!
- Roly Poly: Use the motion-control feature to roll Dood through the level by tilting the uDraw GameTablet.
- Bubble Trouble: Carefully guide Dood through the level by using the Stylus. Don’t touch the sides!
- Fan Frenzy: Move the Stylus around Dood who’s been blown up like a balloon. Blow him around the level. The harder you press, the harder the fan blows.

Source: The Publisher Website.

115397.name: Dora the Explorer: Dora Saves the Crystal Kingdom
115397.description:
Dora and Friends jump, climb, swing, slide and explore their way through the Crystal Kingdom! Authentic character voice of Dora and other characters from the Dora the Explorer TV Show!

Source: The Developer Website.

115398.name: Legions Realm Monthly (Issue 11 - Jul 2003)
rpgissuearticle: Blitzers - Players in the League of their Own
Vyris - A Star Wars Detective Story
115398.description:
Cover is labeled "Volume 2 / Issue 8"

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

115399.name: Ping Pong King
115399.description:
User Summary

A mid '80s video Ping Pong game. Rules are the same. Pong, but on a table with paddles.

115400.name: Dora the Explorer: Dora's Big Birthday Adventure
115400.description:
Help Dora find her way home by jumping, climbing, swinging and sliding through exciting levels ranging from the Dancing Forest to Wizzle Mountain. Based on Dora's Big Birthday Adventure prime-time event and features authentic voice talent from the TV show.

Source: The Developer Website.

115402.name: Dragon Ball: Revenge of King Piccolo
115402.description:
The Dragon Balls are mythical orbs that can grant any wish when all seven of them are brought together. One day Goku, who had been living alone deep in the mountains, encounters a girl named Bluma from the city, and from there the two set out on a quest for the Dragon Balls. One year has passed since their adventurous journey. Goku has once again set out on a journey to search for the Four-star Dragon Ball, which is a momento of his grandfather.

Dragon Ball: Revenge of King Piccolo is a new action-adventure game for the Wii™ that lets players control Goku® as he battles against the Red Ribbon Army and King Piccolo™ in search for the legendary Dragon Balls.

Features

- An all-new adventure game
- Exciting gameplay modes
- Cut scenes from the original anime
- Fight in the World Tournament
- Shop at the store

Source: The Publisher Website.

115403.name: Dream Pinball 3D
115403.description:
A great pinball game should not only be amazing from the start, but should continue to be entertaining every time you play it. This was the thinking behind the development of the newest pinball sensation to hit the Wii - Dream Pinball 3D - with its' 6 cutting edge tables that are beckoning you to try your luck.

We did not skimp on the technology with this game as there are six different style balls, made of different materials, that not only look different, but whose ballistic characteristics will affect the very rolling behaviour of each one of them. Add to that incredible acoustics, state of the art particle technology, HDRI and multilayer 3D sound, realistic tilt function and motion blur effects, and you have the best pinball experience available on the PC that can even be enjoyed by laptops and less powerful non-gaming computers.

Features

- 6 tables with various themes
- Balls made out of 6 materials (steel, two kinds of wood, marble, ivory, gold) with various ballistic characteristics
- Multi-ball with up to 3 balls at once
- Supports state of the art particle effects
- Motion-blur-effects
- Brilliant lightning because of HDRI-textures
- Individual sounds and music for each table
- Multiplayer mode for up to 4 gamers
- 6 dynamic and one fixed camera position
- Individual graphic settings for less powerful systems

Source: The Publisher Website.

115404.name: Pit & Run
115404.description:
User Summary

Pit Run is a simple overhead view simulation Formula 1 racing. Race against computer opponents in order to win races and advance to other tracks.

115405.name: Playgirls
115405.description:
User Summary

Play Girls is a Ball and Paddle game where you hit blocks ala Breakout style. Hit blocks, special blocks and special targets. When you clear blocks it reveals pictures of somewhat clothed women.

115406.name: Plotting
115406.description:
User Summary

Plotting is an interesting abstract video game. You pattern match blocks with the same symbol to grow your block mix. Wild cards have varying effects. In dual play, each person works on their own side.

115407.name: Plump Pop
115407.description:
User Summary

This is an update to Circus, where you use cats, dogs and trampolines to bust layers of various balloons and shapes. Don't drop your bouncing animal and bust all the balloons to get to more levels.

115408.name: Polaris
115408.description:
User Summary

An early Taito game where you play a sub trying to avoid getting blown up by other subs, ships and craft shooting at you. Destroy others when you can.

115409.name: Pop 'n Pop
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
115409.description:
User Summary

A side by side balloon shooter, where you shoot your balloons up to match color and blow them up when you get enough of the same color together. This makes in more difficult on your opponent as it throws them over to their side.

115410.name: Power Excavator
115410.description:
User Summary

A game where you work a giant excavator to dig up ground. Fun with power machines.

115411.name: Prebillian
115411.description:
User Summary

An interesting variant on billiards where you use space ship like launchers to play pool. Various trick shots and specials are available.

115412.name: Prime Time Fighter
115412.description:
User Summary

A boxing game from Taito. Play head to head and beat each other to a pulp.

115413.name: Psychic Force
115413.description:
User Summary

Psychic Force is a 3d head to head fighting game with many special moves and attacks. Had a later sequel Psychic Force 2012.

115414.name: Puchi Carat
115414.description:
User Summary

A head to head ball and paddle game with anime characters from Taito. Knock your gems down to send them to your opponents side.

115415.name: Qix II: Tournament
115415.description:
Source: Wikipedia, "Qix II-Tournament", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Qix II - Tournament is a sequel to the arcade game Qix, released by Taito America Corporation in 1982.

115416.name: Frisky
115416.description:
Card game issued one card at a time in cigarettes made by W A & A C Churchman. Two games are described using these cards.

Frisky Families is a Happy Families game. 52 cards were issued, in 13 sets of four. Each set of four is attributed to a different animal. Frisky himself, is card no 1 and he is a rabbit. The game play is similar to other set collecting games. In his turn, a player may ask another player for a certain card. If that player has such a card, he must hand it over. The turn can now be extended by asking for another card, and so on. When you have a set of four, you may lay it in front of you. After all 13 sets have been collected, the player with the most sets, wins.

Game 2 is just called Frisky.

This is a trick-taking game. In effect, you play with 52 cards, all in one suit, and the higher card is most likely to take the trick. The cards are ranked 2 to 52. Card 1, Frisky' is the highest card though and will always win the trick in which he is played. After all the cards have been played, the player with the most cards in tricks, wins.

The original game was published in 1935. Since then, there has been at least one reproduction set.

115417.name: Carcosa
rpgpodcastepisode: The Silver Lodge Parlour: The Rains down in Africa
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
115417.description:
From the publisher's website:

Warning: For Adults Only! Contains explicit descriptions and illustrations of vile black magic and violence

WEIRD SCIENCE-FANTASY HORROR SETTING

Carcosa is a science-fantasy role-playing game setting with a sandbox approach: whether heroic or opportune, adventurers of all stripes will find freedom and consequence worth their mettle in a horrifying milieu mixing adventure fantasy, the Mythos, and comic book sci-fi with no punches pulled.

Carcosa is compatible with Lamentations Of The Flame Princess RPG and other old school fantasy adventure games. This expanded edition details 800 encounters on the 400-hex map and includes the starter adventure Fungoid Gardens of the Bone Sorcerer.

The PDF version of Carcosa is fully and extensively layered, bookmarked, and linked - truly a state of the art piece of PDF technology.

Carcosa: What Is It?

Men of 13 Races fight for life and power, ignorant of their common past.

When other tools fail, Foul Sorcery is wielded without compunction.

Enigmatic and inhuman Space Aliens have crash-landed on the world.

Psionic Warriors turn the tables on the uncaring Great Old Ones with Strange Technology from the stars and beyond time's provenance, risking Blasphemous Madness and worse to tame the Hostile Planet and push back the darkness... for a time.

Carcosa is a weird science-fantasy horror setting compatible with traditional fantasy role-playing games. It includes:


a new character class: the Sorcerer who summons and controls Cthulhoid entities
a new form of magic, including 96 sorcerous rituals
an easy-to-use psionics system
dice conventions
dozens of new monsters
tables for the random generation of spawn of Shub-Niggurath
5 colors of the desert lotus
countless high-tech weapons and items of the Space Aliens
Random Robot Generator
technological artifacts of the Great Race and of the Primordial Ones
mutations
800 encounters on an outdoor hex map with an area of 34,880 square miles
the Fungoid Gardens of the Bone Sorcerer introductory adventure
and more, all extensively cross-referenced and indexed!


Carcosa was originally released as a homemade 96 page booklet in October 2008, intended as Supplement V to the "original fantasy role-playing game published in 1974." This new printing is thoroughly reorganized and expanded and illustrated, no longer claims a direct tie to that game, and is presented in a 288 page deluxe hardcover format.

115418.name: Isle of the Unknown
rpgpodcastepisode: The Silver Lodge Parlour: The Rains down in Africa
115418.description:
From the publisher's website - -

Isle of the Unknown

A Setting Designed to be Placed in Any Fantasy Campaign!

Formatted as a hex-based adventure location, the Isle contains 330 unique challenges and locations, including over 100 new monsters and dozens of spellcasters with unique abilities.

The book contains over 120 full-color illustrations, including every single monster found on the Isle.

Compatible with Lamentations of the Flame Princess Weird Fantasy Role-Playing and other traditional fantasy role-playing games.

Isle of the Unknown - What Is It?

Geoffrey:

Isle of the Unknown is a hard-core and pure old-school product. I write the sort of thing I wish other people would write and publish. I love, love, love the format of Judges Guild's Wilderlands products. This sort of thing moves my imagination, and it has (to my druthers) very little wasted space. It's 99% pure gold.

That's what I am aiming at with Isle of the Unknown. I want all the wonder of the old Wilderlands, with none of the "OK, I've seen that before." Orcs and sh*t were new back then, but not now. So I've done a Wilderlands[-style] product that is all fantastic and no nostalgia.

115419.name: Anima Tactics: Bella & Aqua
115419.description:
Other than her prodigious elemental powers and obsession with the procurement of supernatural artifacts not much is known about this mysterious young woman. One of the foremost mercenaries of Gaia she works for the highest bidder, only to disappear suddenly once the contract is completed.

Neutral Wanderer Mystic - Lv. 45
At 4 | Dm 4 | Df 9 | Ar 0 | LP: 13 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/4
Constant Companion: Any Party that includes Bella must include Aqua as well. Bella and Aqua are a Team.
ooo - Profusion of Daggers (Magic, Attack)
When Bella uses this attack you must choose two of the options below, adding their special effects:
-Pale Smile: If the attack causes damage, the target suffers Paralyze Lvl 1. Effect 15.
-Jealous Fang: If the attack causes damage, the target suffers Poison Lvl 2. Effect 16.
-Queen Azazel: The attack ignores Armor. If it causes damage, all positive state counters are removed from the target.
-Leaf Leak: Profusion of Daggers becomes a Ranged Attack : distance 16 inches.
-Eros: If the attack causes damage, Bella recovers an amount of Life Points equal to the amount of damage dealt.
-Igniting Glare: Damage +4.
-Haley's Tear: Attack +3.
Neutral Wanderer Warrior/Mystic - Lv. 10
At 5 | Dm 4 | Df 8 | Ar 0 | LP: 8 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 2/4
Constant Companion: A group including Bella must include Aqua. Bella and Aqua are a Team.
Elemental Entity: Aqua can’t have Advantage Cards.
ooo - Absolon (Magic, Charge)
At the start of this Charge if Aqua is within 4 inches of Bella, it gets Attack +2. Absolon causes Throw.
oo - Dam (Magic, Effect)
An enemy unit within 2 inches of Aqua suffers Paralyze Lvl 1. Effect 15.
o - Flow (Magic, Effect)
An enemy unit with a small base that is in base-to-base contact with Aqua is moved away from Aqua 2 inches.
oo - Recovery (Magic, Effect)
If Bella is in Aqua’s Control Zone, she recovers 1 Action Point.

115420.name: Anima Tactics: Cenette
115420.description:
Despite being the third Princess Daphne, Cennette chose to leave Rose Island to its fate and pursue the man she loves, Drake. Blessed with angelic blood and a stunning natural aptitude for combat, Cennette is renowned as one of the most skilled fighters of her time. At Drake’s side she doesn’t hesitate to take arms when necessary.

Light Wanderer Warrior - Lv. 45
At 5 | Dm 3 | Df 10 | Ar 0 | LP 12 | Re 10 | Mo 12/16 | AP 3/4
Master Dodge: Whenever Cenette Dodges successfully, you may move her 2 inches. This movement may be used to leave Hand-to-hand combat without having used an Action to Escape previously.
Supreme Agility: When Cenette Charges (Normal or Special) she can change the direction of her Line of Charge one time. The Charge can still be Intercepted if she passes close enough to an enemy Unit.
oooo - Albas (Ki, Charge)
+3 Attack / +2 Damage.
ooo - Last Rose (Ki, Attack)
+5 Attack.
A part of Team Condemned Lovers along with Drake

115421.name: Anima Tactics: Dereck Shezard
115421.description:
Shrouded by mystery and legend, Dereck Shezzard is one of the most powerful Dominus warriors in the world. Infused with the unrivalled powers of the Dragon Seals, he is an unstoppable god
on the battlefield.

Neutral Wanderer Warrior - Lv. 65
At 6 | Dm 5 | Df 10 | Ar 0 | LP: 18 | Re 10 | Mo 8/12 | AP 3/5
oo - Neokinesis (Ki, Effect, Reactive)
Dereck gains Lv1 Haste.
ooo - Neo Bullet (Ki, Ranged Attack)
Distance Attack (16 inch).
ooooo - Neo Genesis (Ki, Attack)
Special Impact. +4 Attack / +4 Damage.
ooo - Seals of the Dragon (Ki, Effect)
Gain +2 to Attack, Defense and Damage.
Upkeep: o

115422.name: Race Condition
115422.description:
Race Condition is a card game that allows competing players to modify a shared computer program represented by playing cards.

Game cards and counters are arranged on a table top to represent the order of and relationship between instructions, the current instruction, and the values of variables. Competing players take turns modifying the computer program until one of them achieves his or her objective of setting a variable to a particular value. Players accomplish their goals by appending instructions to the program, and by performing special actions such as inserting, deleting, or moving instructions. As the players modify the program, it advances, modifying variables and potentially moving players closer to or further from their objectives.

115423.name: Gibbets
115423.description:
User Summary

Use your bow and arrow to save people being hanged in this physics puzzle by Konstantin Boronenkov. Be careful as you have limited amount of arrows and you do not want to harm the ones you are saving, but don't take too long as time for them is running out.

115424.name: Gibbets 2
115424.description:
User Summary

Once again, you'll try to save people being hanged using your bow and arrow in this physics puzzle sequel by Konstantin Boronenkov.

115425.name: Gibbets 3
115425.description:
User Summary

The third part for the physics puzzle series by Konstantin Boronenkov. Use your bow and arrow to save people being hanged. You only have limited amount of arrows, but you'll need to be quick as time for them is running out.

115426.name: Collapse it
115426.description:
User Summary

Blow up buildings and try to kill every person near the demolition site. Game by Konstantin Boronenkov.

115427.name: Jonnakas Jott
115427.description:
The game was published in 2005 as a part of a local educational program called "Mina Ise" (I myself). The game consists of 45 different cards, where there are 22 card pairs, where each pair has a regular (local Estonian, non-foregin) letters and J letter as being a part vowel and part consonant alone, making it to be 45 cards.
Each card pair has something drawn on it, either a living thing or some item. Under the picture there are a word and under a word a sentence to use the word in. Trick is the correct "kääne" (word ending).
Scoring has multiple possibilities.

Variant 1: Naming the thing on the picture and the letter it begins with scores you the card. 10 cards wins the game.

Variant 2: Each word has parts of it different colored, while yellow part is 1 point, red part 3 points and blue part 5 points. 35 points and you win the game.

115428.name: Euroopa reis
115428.description:
From the publisher:
Game made by a local travel agency to find about more about traveling in Europe.
Game is basic roll and move, with treasure collection and trivia. Each players goal is to travel to a location shown on the card they have. Game comes with a 104 pages rule book which contains info for each country destination.
Be the first to reach destination to win the game.

Game comes in the nice box shaped like a briefcase.

115429.name: Liber Cantiones (Revised Edition)
115429.description:
User Summary

For the hardcover edition of the 4th Edition of Das Schwarze Auge a new version of the Spellbook Liber Cantiones was released. Like the original release (Liber Cantiones) it contains one spell per page. Not included in this issue are the rituals of the various spellcaster classes which now can be found in Wege der Zauberei.

115430.name: Midrimäng
115430.description:
First game in a series of 4, in which each game is one season in the year.
The series in meant to be education for children.

Each game in the series is meant for 2-12 young players. The first game called "Midrimäng" is about winter and the wonder of Christmas. All games later can be combines into one large game.

Game is played very easily.
Each player is a small elf that must hide behind pine trees and deliver candies into the shoes of kids. Game has a eyes of children part (for adult player) that once each turn moves around and tries to find little elves.
Do you hide or deliver for points - you decide!

Winner is the first to deliver all candies.

115431.name: Ape Escape 2
115431.description:
This game takes place after the events in Ape Escape, where Kakeru (Spike in the U.S. version, named "Spike" in the original U.K. Ape Escape) stopped Specter from taking over the world. It is a few years later, and The Professor left for a vacation leaving his granddaughter, Natsumi (Natalie in the U.S. version)[2], and Spike's cousin, Hikaru (Jimmy in the U.S. version), to watch over the laboratory. The Professor has left them with one task: deliver a load of monkey pants to the monkeys in Monkey Park. Hikaru accidentally sends not only the monkey pants, but The Peak Point Helmets as well. Specter gets a hold of one, and yet again makes an army of monkeys bent on ruling the world. Jimmy aims to capture all the monkeys and stop Specter. However, Specter has supplied five monkeys with Vita-Z bananas, making them stronger and more intelligent than the average monkeys.

Hikaru manages to capture all of the Freaky Monkey Five, except Yellow Monkey. Before his fight with White Monkey, Pipotchi, a baby monkey accompanying Hikaru, is kidnapped, in order to transfer the data in his Peak Point Helmet into a device called the Lethargy Laser. Rescuing Pipotchi, Hikaru makes his way through a monkey controlled military base, and confronts Specter, who is waiting for him with a hi-tech gunship. Before the two can battle, Yellow Monkey, now a giant monster thanks to an overdose on Vita-Z bananas attacks the facility. Specter flees, and Hikaru manages to downsize and capture Yellow.

Hikaru, the Professor and Natsumi then discover the purpose of the Lethargy Laser. By firing it at the globe, all humans worldwide will lose the will to fight back, making it easier for Specter and the monkeys to take over the world. Hikaru confronts Specter at his moonbase, who attacks him with a giant robot. Once defeated, Specter attempts to fire the laser, but Hikaru states that humans will never give up, and captures him. Jimmy and Pipotchi then flee the exploding moonbase.

Shortly afterwards, Specter escapes and goes into hiding. Hikaru then proceeds to capture all the remaining monkeys before the Professor discovers Specter's hiding place. Hikaru warps there, encountering Specter, and the two of them battle again. Specter loses and is once again captured. The game ends with Spike visiting the laboratory, which is destroyed when Hikaru accidentally crashes a spaceship into it.

Gameplay is similar to the previous game. Movement is controlled with the left analogue stick and R buttons, and gadgets are controlled with the right analogue stick. Three new gadgets are added, the Electro Magnet, used for pulling metal blocks and clinging onto metal surfaces, the Water Cannon used for putting out fires, and the Bananarang, that can attract monkeys with a banana fragrance. A new feature is the ability to change the gadget loadout by holding down one of the gadget buttons and changing the gadget.

Also introduced in this game is Pipotchi, a sidekick who can assist Jimmy in reaching ledges and occasionally revive him if he's knocked out. Also, the gotcha coins that spawn from enemies are used as currency for bonuses, and can multiply in worth if left alone.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ape Escape 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115432.name: Dreamworks Super Star Kartz
115432.description:
Get in the driver’s seat for some wacky, wild and wondrous kart racing action as your favorite DreamWorks® Animation characters are brought together for the very first time!

Features

-For the first time ever, race to the finish line with your favorite characters from Shrek, Madagascar, How To Train Your Dragon & Monsters vs. Aliens!
-Play as Shrek, Donkey, Alex, King Julien, Hiccup, B.O.B. and many more!
-Race on amazing tracks from your favorite movie locations such as Shrek’s Swamp, the New York City Zoo and the Island of Berk!
-Challenge up to 3 of your friends in hilariously fun multi-player action or dominate the competition in head-to-head battle-mode (console only).
-Perform crazy stunts, jumps, and tricks that showcase your favorite character’s unique personality.
-Collect awesome power-ups for a speed boost or launch special projectiles to capture the checkered flag.
-Limited edition Wii bundle includes a DreamWorks Animation racing wheel customizable with 25 awesome stickers!

Source: The Publisher Website.

115433.name: Appleseed EX
115433.description:
Appleseed EX is a video game by Sega for the PlayStation 2 based on the 2004 film of the same name and on the manga of the same name by Masamune Shirow. The game was released in February 2007, as well as the Limited Box set.

Source: Wikipedia, "Appleseed EX", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115434.name: Family Fun Football
115434.description:
Features

Simple Playbook: Family Fun Football offers a coaching playbook that makes it easy for everyone to learn and play the game of football!

Power Up: Earn power-ups during gameplay to enhance certain attributes including speed, strength, passing, and interception for a limited amount of time. Use them wisely to gain momentum in the game.

Quickplay: Jump right into the action! Just select two teams and the stadium you want to play in to get started. Up to 4 players can play for 2-on-2 football fun!

Season: Play through a 9 game season, each game against a different opponent. Defeat every team to be the best!

Tournament: Play your way through a double-elimination tournament and be the last team standing to win it all!

Mascot Mode: You can play as your team's mascot, or as one of 10 unlockable mascots in Mascot Mode.

Source: The Game Website.

115435.name: Nicht Ja, Nicht Nein
115435.description:
Object of the game is during the questions try other players
to answer forbidden words YES or NO. If somebody answer so
others must then quickly ring the bell to move their pawn on the gameboard if they are the quickest.

The winner is who gets there first with his character in the middle of the board.

115437.name: Arena Football
115437.description:
Arena Football is a PlayStation 2 and Xbox video game developed by Electronic Arts (under their EA Sports brand). It was released on February 7, 2006. The cover features quarterback John Dutton, from ArenaBowl XIXs champion team, the Colorado Crush. The game is similar to EA's other simulation football games (NCAA Football and Madden NFL Football), but adopts a style of play that is similar to the faster and more frantic paced Arena game. The game includes all the rules, rosters, and teams for the AFL season.

All of the teams that are competing in the 2006 season are included. The New Orleans VooDoo have been excluded because they have temporarily halted operations due to Hurricane Katrina. However, their logo is available for use in the game's create-a-team feature. The VooDoo resumed operations in 2007. The Kansas City Brigade franchise and its colors have been included, but the official name and logo didn't make it in because they were unveiled after the game had gone into production so the team was known as the Kansas City KC in the video game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Arena Football (2006 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115438.description:
From the publisher:
This is a game about finding connections between different things. Game comes with so many great cards that will blow your mind.
Each player moves around the game board (Monopoly like board), where each space is a category.
Under that category someone will draw a card and asks you something. Example: "How is connected chicken egg and A4 paper format?".
Answer correct, collect the card and keep moving. Idea is to reach the center field and be crowned as smart as Da Vinci himself.
115438.name: Da Vinci

115439.name: Arena Football: Road to Glory
115439.description:
Arena Football: Road to Glory is a PlayStation 2 video game developed by Electronic Arts (under their EA Sports brand). It was released on February 21, 2007. The cover features fullback/linebacker Bob McMillen, from ArenaBowl XX's champion team, the Chicago Rush. The game includes all the rules, rosters, and teams for the AFL season.

For the first time, the Arena Football minor league, af2, appeared in this series. Players can us these teams to participate in full seasons in the af2 including the Arena Cup game.

Bossier-Shreveport Battle Wings
Bakersfield Blitz+
Green Bay Blizzard
Albany Conquest
Central Valley Coyotes
Rio Grande Valley Dorados
Amarillo Dusters
Louisville Fire
Florida Firecats
Everett Hawks
Macon Knights
Stockton Lightning
Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Pioneers
Spokane Shock
Quad City Steamwheelers
Birmingham Steeldogs
Tulsa Talons
Arkansas Twisters
Tennessee Valley Vipers
South Georgia Wildcats
Manchester Wolves
Memphis Xplorers
Oklahoma City Yard Dawgz

Source: Wikipedia, "Arena Football: Road to Glory", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115440.name: Army Men: Air Attack 2
115440.description:
Army Men: Air Attack 2 is a shooter game developed and published by 3DO. Although originally made for the first PlayStation platform, it was reissued on PlayStation 2.

It is a sequel to Army Men: Air Attack in which the green and tan armies battle in the air via Huey, Super Stallion, Apache and Chinook helicopters.

Source: Wikipedia, "Army Men: Air Attack 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115441.name: Army Men: Green Rogue
115441.description:
Set during the time of "Sarge's Heroes", the Green Army creates a super soldier composed of DNA spliced from all the members of Bravo Company. Plastro tries to capture the super soldier, but the crash-landing of the helicopter transporting it inadvertently awakens Omega Soldier, causing a one-man rampage against Tan forces. Unique to this game is the fact that all of Omega Soldier's weapons are made of metal instead of plastic.

Source: Wikipedia, "Army Men: Green Rogue", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115442.name: Proteus (Issue 20)
115442.description:
User summary:

Proteus magazine ceased regular publication with issue #19. One last special was released in Christmas 1988, which contained two solo adventures: The Orchid of Life and Treasures of the Cursed Pyramid. (The latter adventure was first published in issue #8.)

115443.name: Army Men: Major Malfunction
115443.description:
Army Men: Major Malfunction is a game in the Army Men franchise released by Global Star Software in 2006 for Xbox and PlayStation 2 consoles. The name Major Malfunction is derived from R. Lee Ermey's quote in Full Metal Jacket, "What is your major malfunction, numbnuts?".

The main character is a soldier named Private Anderson. He is forced to fight his way through many enemy soldiers as he tries to defeat the main villain named Major Malfunction who has taken over the house with his toy army.

Source: Wikipedia, "Army Men: Major Malfunction", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115444.name: Army Men: Sarge's War
115444.description:
Army Men: Sarge's War is a 2004 game in the Army Men video game series. It was the first game in the series to be created by Global Star Software instead of series creator 3DO and the last game to follow the series. The game is more mature and darker than earlier games in the series. Sarge makes no comical moves, holes are blown into soldiers, and the weapons are also made of metal.

The game begins with an attack on Greentown by the Tan army and Sarge battling through the war-torn city to save it. After the battle, Sarge is informed by Colonel Grimm that the Tan Army has surrendered and that there will be a peace ceremony later that night, but that a rogue Tan division - Operation "Vengeance" - led by Lord Malice has stolen some infantry molds and can now build an army. Sarge's mission is to find and capture Malice, recover the stolen molds, and locate a missing recon squad.

Sarge arrives in the area (a beach) and battles his way to the Tan portal. There, he discovers plans indicating that Malice has placed a bomb at the peace ceremony, hidden in the Peace Statue. Sarge charges through the portal to stop the ceremony, but he is too late - as the bomb goes off, Plastro, Colonel Grimm, the Heroes and the Green and Tan armies are annihilated.Sarge then sets out to kill Malice.

He battles his way through the remains of Greentown to another Tan portal. Upon proceeding through the portal, he finds himself in Malice's artillery base. Sarge destroys all the artillery and discovers a plastic well mine that Malice is using to build his army. Sarge floods the mine, rendering it nearly useless. He then travels across the desert to Malice's castle. Malice is using the castle as a communication center for his air and ground forces, as well as a prison base for some of the Green army's finest men. Sarge penetrates the castle's defenses, frees the prisoners and destroys the communications tower. Discovering a passage from the castle to a kitchen in the Real World, Sarge flashes back to a time when he was in a similar kitchen, in a squad led by Major Gooding. During a mission, Gooding and his squad were ambushed by Tan forces. During the ambush, Sarge called in an air strike and found Gooding's arm near the sink, leading him to the conclusion that Gooding was dead. As Sarge takes off in the helicopter, the flashback ends, and Sarge moves forth.

At the end of the game, Sarge finally reaches Lord Malice's headquarters, where he battles Malice himself. After defeating and fatally wounding Malice, Sarge asks him why he killed the Greens and Tans in Greentown. Malice reveals that it was simply to make Sarge suffer. Sarge removes Malice's face mask and discovers that he was actually Major Gooding, who was accidentally left for dead. Eventually, the Tan found him and changed him into the Lord Malice he is now. At the end of the scene, Sarge is seen walking out, saying that war makes ultimately no sense.

The closing animation reveals storage tubes inscribed with the names of the deceased soldiers from the Greentown attack, hinting that Col. Grimm and the Heroes, along with Vikki, may not have died, and perhaps Malice had simply killed copies of them in order to play on Sarge's emotions - an action that ultimately was Lord Malice's undoing, According to the strongest rumor the storage tubes might have been metal coffins to sum up the story.

The events described at the end of Sarge's War occur during the beginning of Army Men II, making the assumption that both games have a relation and explaining the lack of iconic characters but what is confusing is the clear different appearance of Plastro and Sarge, and Plastro supposedly died in Sarge's war at the bombing of Greentown.

Source: Wikipedia, "Army Men: Sarge's War", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115445.name: Läbi lodu rabast randa
115445.description:
Educational game made for schools to introduce 4 parts of the nature. Game is simple, just roll and move through the game board and collect knowledge.
On the way to the end, you must stop on card spaces and answer what it on the picture.

Also, the rule book is 76 pages and can be used as small RPG with d20 dice and a journey to the nature.
On they way you have to get out of swamps and make choices of roads and so on. Goal is still to reach the end, but this way the game is more educational than the regular way.

First one to reach the end is the winner.

Game was created as a part of a student program and was put together by over 50 student ideas.

115446.name: ATV Offroad Fury 4
115446.description:
ATV Offroad Fury 4 is the fourth installment of the ATV Offroad Fury series, and the sequel to ATV Offroad Fury 3.

ATV Offroad Fury 4 sees the introduction of new vehicles such as MX motocycles, Trophy Trucks and Dune Buggies, alongside existing ATV quad racers; this allows the game to include up to 50 Championship Modes. In addition to improved graphics, it also has an additional 60 tracks and improved online gaming.

In terms of in-game controls, more tricks are possible while the player is on an MX motorcycle, but none can be performed while the player is controlling a Trophy Truck and Dune Buggy. Similar to the risk of being thrown off an ATV or motorcycle in the game, Trophy Trucks and Dune Buggies are vulnerable to rollovers, from which the player's vehicle will be automatically reset back on all four wheels, as are the ATV and motorcycle. The game also offers tutorials on how to drive Trophy Trucks and Dune Buggies.

ATV Offroad Fury 4 includes more mini-games, such as "Ice Hockey" (introduced in ATV Offroad Fury 2), "Scavenger Hunt", "King Of The Hill", "Bowling", and "Ring of Fire".

Online capabilities for this game have ended.

Source: Wikipedia, "ATV Offroad Fury 4", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115447.name: Sword Girls
115447.description:
Sword Girls is an online collectible card game featuring stunning anime artwork and strategic game play. Sword Girls offers an engaging experience whether it's your first card game or you're a seasoned veteran. The game offers hundreds of unique and alluring cards to collect.

An innovative card-crafting system provides an exciting new way to obtain additional cards and use them to build powerful decks. Players can duel each other, fight their way through dungeons, and challenge powerful bosses. Sword Girls is free to play and works on any web browser or Flash-enabled mobile device.

Source: The Game Website.

115448.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 62 - Mar/Apr 1996)
rpgissuearticle: Die Barone sterben wie die Fliegen
Eine neue Dämonenschlacht steht uns bevor!
Steckt Vinsal hinter den Unruhen auf Maraskan?
Wo ist die Comtessa von Honingen?
115448.description:
Publication date in the game world: Boron 26 Hal / 1019 BF.

Included in this issue was the 5th issue of the magazine Salamander, an ingame magizine about the arcane arts.

For a table of contents see the articles below.

115449.name: Dragon Magazine (Issue 5 - Set 1995)
115449.description:
Dragon Magazine Brazil
Issue 5
September 1995

Dos Grupos aos Clubes
(From Groups to Clubs)

Cover art by Donald Clavette

115450.name: Five Card Deluxe
115450.description:
If you like solitaire or poker then you'll love Five Card Deluxe! Place cards from the deck onto the table to form poker hands and score points. Four thrilling game modes let you play the way you want to, while the save feature lets you pick up where you left off! Earn wild cards in "Joker's Wild" or compare your scores with others from around the world in "Tournament" mode. Can you score enough points to advance to the next level?

Source: The Game Website.

115451.name: War Online
115451.description:
War Online captures all the fun of the thrilling card game right in your web browser! Casino-stlye War now comes to you in a high-stakes online version and you get to play whenever and wherever you want. Get your adrenaline pumping and heart racing as you flip through each round and collect your chips. Don't get too caught up though because you can lose it all in one hand! Play War Online today for some fast card game fun!

Source: The Game Website.

115452.name: Lucky Streak Poker
115452.description:
Choose your cards and cross your fingers because a smart bet and a lucky draw are all it takes to go on a streak in this exciting and innovative game. The name of the game is 5-card poker, but with a fun new twist: 'Lucky' cards that actually increase your odds. Get three or more of these special cards in a winning hand and it becomes nearly impossible to lose!

Source: The Game Website.

115453.name: Slingo Deluxe
115453.description:
Slingo is the unique and exciting combination of classic favorites Bingo and Slots. It was first developed as a traditional 5-reel slot machine in 1995 and then one year later, it became one of the biggest multiplayer online games on America Online. This new Slingo is the very first downloadable version of the game that will let you play without being online. It features sharp graphics, saved stats, top ten lists, custom backgrounds plus a brand new challenging game mode "PATTERN"!. The Slingo experience appeals to anyone who enjoys playing games, winning prizes and having fun! The new SLINGO Deluxe game contains a number of great features:

Easy To Play! * Easy to learn, but deceptively addictive. How high a score can you get? 3 Exciting New Versions! * Classic - new version of one of the most popular games on the internet. * Mixed Matrix - A brain-teaser - how fast can you find the scrambled numbers? * Patterns - a real challenge with 30 patterns to be sequentially matched * All game modes with multiple Joker bonuses! Change Background Screens! * Select from a number of built in background screens * Add your own custom backgrounds or even photos to the game Play At Your Own Pace! * Set the Variable Spin Timer to fast, medium or slow All New Score Tracking! * Tracks your game scores * Records your all time high game scores * Ranks you among your competitors * Keeps separate scores for each game version New Game Options! * Full Screen or Window * Sound Controls (on/off/volume)




Source: The Game Website.

115454.name: Five Card Slingo
115454.description:
Are you ready to play 12 hands of poker at once!? 5 Card Slingo Deluxe is the exciting game that combines the fast paced fun of Slingo with strategic poker playing action. It features 3 modes of game play, including the brand new Mixed Matrix, which lets you put the cards anywhere! It also saves your best hand in each mode, keeps track of your top scores and has a top ten list to highlight all of the big winners. Do you have what it takes to be one of them? Play 5 Card Slingo today and get lucky!

Source: The Game Website.

115455.name: High Velocity Duelling (Issue 1.01)
115455.description:
User Summary

In this issue: News, ADQ, AADA Chapters, & Other CW Pages.

115456.name: Dragon Magazine (Issue 6 - Out 1995)
115456.description:
Dragon Magazine Brazil
Issue 6
October 1995

FOR - Forgotten Realms - Os Reinos Esquecidos.

Cover art by Fred Fields

115457.name: Dragon Magazine (Issue 7 - Nov 1995)
115457.description:
Dragon Magazine Brazil
Issue 7
November 1995

GenCon - O Paraíso do RPG
(GenCon - The RPG Paradise)

Cover art by Jeff Easley

115458.name: Diner Dash - Hometown Hero
115458.description:
Diner Dash: Hometown Hero is the fourth installment in the Diner Dash series of casual games. It was developed by PlayFirst and published by PlayFirst, KatGames, and Big Splash Games. it was launched on September 25, 2007. Diner Dash: Hometown Hero is a strategy game that simulates running a restaurant. It has an ESRB rating of E for everyone.

Flo returns to her hometown to visit her Grandma, Florence, only to find that the place has become a run-down ghost town. Flo decides to use her culinary skills to rejuvenate the town by improving the restaurants at all the formerly popular hangouts.


Gameplay involves seating customers as they enter the restaurant. One must drag and drop each group of customers to a table appropriate for their group size. Extra points are given for seating a customer in a chair that is the same color as the customer's clothing. Then, Flo must take their orders, send the order to the kitchen, deliver the food, give the group the check, and clean the table for new customers. There is hardly ever only one group of customers at a time, so the player must use time management in order to keep all of the customers happy. Each group of customers has a row of hearts at their table in order to show their mood. If the mood drops low enough, the customers will leave and you lose money. However, if the customers remain happy, they will stay and tip well. Each level has a money goal that one must reach in order to continue on to the next level. As the player moves from level to level, they are able to select new upgrades for the restaurant. New elements are also added such as spills or desert in different levels in order to make the game more challenging and interesting. The player also has the option of playing a "continuous shift" where there are no levels or story. You just continue to play to see how much money you can earn.

Source: Wikipedia, "Diner Dash: Hometown Hero", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115459.name: Dragon Magazine (Issue 8 - Dec 1995)
115459.description:
Dragon Magazine Brazil
Issue 8
December 1995

Duas cabeças pensam melhor do que uma
(Two heads think better than one)

Cover art by Gerald Brom

115460.name: Diner Dash 5 - BOOM!
115460.description:
Diner Dash 5: BOOM! is the 5th installment of the Diner Dash series, it also features voice-acting to give more life to the characters. It was developed by PlayFirst and released to the public on March 16, 2010.

A mysterious figure is lurking around Flo's diner, grabbing his bucket of paint and removing the word "Fat" from "Fat Free Breakfast", which makes Flo's Diner looks like it's having a free breakfast promo. The next day, Flo and Chef Cookie are surprised by the sign, unfortunately it is too late. After she opens the diner, customers start running and overloading the diner, and as a result, Flo's Diner explodes.
Players can play at 5 different venues, each venue contains 10 story mode level and after finishing the venue, a bonus level is given to players, in note that the bonus level goal is extremely high, and the shift time is longer than usual. At each venue, players are given a challenge to protect the tables from disasters such as: winds, earthquakes, rains, and fuse box problems however, these disasters can be avoided by buying the upgrades available in the upgrade shop. Unlike the previous Diner Dash games, players can purchase upgrades during the start of a level, these upgrades can be bought using the money earned in the previous shift. Some upgrades are permanent (example: faster chef, faster shoes, and disaster protection) but some are just for one level and cost more expensive than any upgrades (example: podium helper, salad bar helper, and extra hands) Players can also customize the diner and the venues, the venues can be customized at several levels, there are four different items to be customized, after choosing which item to be customized, players can choose one of several different venue upgrades, in the end all four of customizer options will be finished and the player is awarded with a venue medal. The Diner can also be customized, unlike venue customizer, the Diner customizer objects will unlock one by one with finishing levels. Players can also enjoy all new customer and a new feature: townies. Townies are one of Flo's customer that didn't have any patients, they come in many different forms, they can become a regular customer by dragging them to the correct group, if the player reunites them with the correct group, they'll receive a bonus points. There's also a challenge where players have to drag Hal the hungryman into a disaster table, where he must fix a small problem from the customer, after dragging Hal, player will earn bonus points.

Source: Wikipedia, "Diner Dash 5: BOOM!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

115461.name: Diner Dash - Flo Through Time
115461.description:
Join Flo and your favorite DinerTown residents on a hilarious, harrowing, and heroic journey through the very fabric of time! It all starts when Grandma Florence tinkers with the diner microwave, turning it into a powerful time machine! If you think you're good at time-management, you need to play this all-new episodes collection and see if you have what it takes to become the best DASHgame player of all time! Play 5 new restaurants with 10 levels each:

- Serve up saber tooth burgers in the Caveman Cafe
- Feed the Nile in style at the Pharaoh's Feast
- Doth thou want fries with that? Chivalry lives in the All Knight Diner!
- Feed th' crew or walk th' plank in the Buccaneer Bistro. Yar!
- Join the sky-high futuristic fun-fest in the Snack to the Future Diner!

Source: The Game Website.

115462.name: Dragon Magazine (Issue 9 - Jan 1996)
115462.description:
Dragon Magazine Brazil
Issue 9
January 1996

Final de Ano
(End of Year)

Cover art by Peter Clarke

115463.name: Dragon Magazine (Issue 10 - Fev 1996)
115463.description:
Dragon Magazine Brazil
Issue 10
January 1996

Universos em Expansão
(Extended Universes)

Cover art by Keith Parkinson

115464.name: Dragon Magazine (Issue 11 - Mar 1996)
115464.description:
Dragon Magazine Brazil
Issue 11
March 1996

O jogo dos Iniciantes
(The Game of Newbies)

Cover art by Tim Bradstreet and Fred Fields

115465.name: Dragon Magazine (Issue 12 - Set 1995)
115465.description:
Dragon Magazine Brazil
Issue 12
April 1996

Os Falsos Morto-Vivos
(The Fake Undead)

Cover art by Sam Rakeland

115466.name: Dragon Magazine (Issue 13 - May 1996)
115466.description:
Dragon Magazine Brazil
Issue 13
May 1996

Oito Maneiras de se Domar o Lorde Negro do Mal
(Eigth ways to dominate the Dark Lord of Evil)

Cover art by Robh Ruppel

115467.name: Puhta vee ABC
115467.description:
From the publisher:
"Clean water ABC" is a educational game about saving pure water. Game board is a pipeline to different parts in a house and all players starts from a plant that pumps water.
Goal is to reduce the water consume.
Players go around the house and stop leaks, not using water while washing hands etc.
When you have certain amount of points, you can proceed to the end - waste water plant.
First one there is the winner.

Dragon Magazine Brazil

Visão nas Trevas
(Darkvision)

Cover art by Les Dorscheid

115469.name: Merrie England: The Age of Chivalry
115469.description:
Description from the BRP Central message board:

Merrie England is a setting that allows you to play in medieval England, but an England where Robin Hood roams the forests, where evil magicians cast spells on their enemies, where great dragons terrorise the land and where the fairy folk still rule Fair Elfland.

This book contains character generation for Norman, Saxon, Jewish, Welsh, Cornish, Scottish, Irish, Fairy, Saracen or Moor player characters and has descriptions and rules for magic use and religions, as well as medieval background, scenario hooks and historical figures.

Revel in the mysteries of Morris Dancing, crusade against the heathen, uncover the secrets of the Masons, oppose the unjust taxes of your absent king, or simply abuse your authority over peasants and vassals. Your imagination is the only limit!

By Simon Phipp. 200 pages. Published December 2011 by Alephtar Games.

115470.name: Kuidas valmib leib?
115470.description:
Promotional game for bread. The game is about making bread.

Game is played on a Monopoly like game board, with outer track being the break making track and inner snake like track for getting points to reach next levels on your bread making track.

Game is played in turns and in the inner track. You move there according to dice rolls and do what the spaces say. Each time you reach red space, you can take next step on the bread making track and reading out loud, how the process is made.
Winner is the first player to finish the bread.

115474.name: Expell
115474.description:
"When two wizards test their strengths against eachother in a magic duel several factors decides the outcome; the ability to learn and adapt fast to changes, flexibility in strategy and tactics when necessary, master of both attack and defense, courage to try the unknown and wits to outsmart the other combatant."
All these things matter when playing Expell.

Expell is a deck building game set in a magical environment. Two or more players compete for survival as wizards. Make the best use of the Grimoire to optimize your deck of spells to defeat your enemies. The objective of the game is to exhaust the opponent(s) willpower with a good combination of spells and magical items.

"No strategy is good but the strategy to observe, adapt and act faster than your enemy."

The game components:

216 Spell cards (24 different spells with 9 cards each)
48 Power cards
48 Darkness cards
Willpower tokens

115480.description:
Objective: catch as many valuable fishes as possible before returning safely to fisherman's cottage
- acting/moving by turn -
roll the die, move according rolled number; ending on an 'A' marked space roll the die again 1-3 ==> bad luck; 4-6 lucky
sometime you may - if position is marked with 2 or 3 - try again.
Places are suitable for different sorts of fish - more or less valuable ==> see table
you may also take a more risky decision: get a boat and reach very rich in fish position - but you can get lost, too;
game ends if last (surviving) player has returned to fisherman's cottage

115483.name: The Basic System Core
115483.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to The Basic System. This is a quick-start set of basic game rules usable for just about any setting. It was designed with EASY gameplay in mind. The rules are very simple, and there is a lot of room for player and Game Master creativity.

115484.name: TBS 1980
115484.description:
From Introduction:

We’ve all seen shows like Magnum PI and Murder She Wrote. But there really hasn't been a game to reflect on this. Sure you have your retro 80’s superhero games, but what about your TV shows? This game is designed to allow players and game masters to create characters and adventures set in the 1980’s using TBS (The Basic System).

115485.name: Alien Files
115485.description:
From Introduction:

For the last sixty years humanity has been sending satellites and other crud into space. We think that no one out there cares. We aren’t even sure if there is life out there. But each year tons of space debris falls to Earth and each year more and more unexplained occurrences happen. So before you scream "Oh, X-Files." Think again. The government watchdog group "Big Brother" has spent years taking preventative measures to keep the alien mess from becoming messy. Their mission: Exterminate the Alien Threat and make sure that no one knows.

115486.name: American Aftermath
115486.description:
From Introduction:

In 2007 President Howard Dean is dead. The West Coast is a fiery grave as terrorists manage to sneak a nuclear bomb through the shipping lanes after President Dean dismantled the Department of Homeland Security. The East Coast has become a chemical cesspool after a hidden Al Qaeda army hit us on our soil. Rural America suffers the hardest losses as thousands of miles of national forests and rural towns are sprayed with toxic chemicals by crop dusters. America is in ruins. The borders are closed by the remaining military forces left and the police departments are forced to act as our National Guard. Vice President Al Gore is assassinated while visiting California. Washington is hit shortly afterwards by a nuke which was hidden in a Metro bus. There is no more government.

It is now 2010. Three years after the United States disaster a new government made up of military officers is formed. They manage to secure the country and begin an operation to weed out the Al Qaeda army. Rumors have been circulating about strange events occurring in rural America. Cannibalism, murder and anarchy have been getting out of hand. SWAT teams have been sent to investigate and control the situation. Wholes towns have been evacuated leaving much of the rural communities empty. Anyone who can be saved is.

115487.name: Battlesuit Construction
115487.description:
User summary:

Rules for building mechanical suits for use in supers or sci-fi games.

115488.name: Power Generator
115488.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to Jay's TBS Power Generator or now more famously known as PG. I am presenting here a quick start way to get your TBS games off the ground. Without adding anything new to the existing TBS core rules players can create fantastic powers, abilities and power suits, all in a matter of minutes. All it takes is an imagination and any basic knowledge of comics. PG works using your END MSB times 10 as a base for power creation with variations for Psionics, Magic and High Tech creations. We’ll call these Jacked Points or JP since they jack up your character in one way or another.

115489.name: High Velocity Duelling (Issue 1.02)
115489.description:
User Summary

In this issue: News, ADQ, AADA Chapters, & Other CW Pages.

115490.name: High Velocity Duelling (Issue 1.03)
115490.description:
User Summary

In this issue: News, Designing, ADQ, AADA Chapters, Other CW Pages, & Desert Duelling.

115492.name: Mobile Suit Gundam: Gihren's Ambition
115492.description:
User Summary

Giren No Yabo is a turn-based strategy game based on the Mobile Suit Gundam One Year War conflict.

The player chooses to play the side of the Federation or the Principality of Zeon and attempts to defeat the opposite side with a scenario or complete victory over the course of 150 turns.

The game includes both political and military elements to manage.

115493.name: Fictional Reality (Issue 17 - Sep 2004)
115493.description:
Cover by Marcin Rado Kurczewski

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below

115494.name: To Build A Better Starship
115494.description:
From Introduction:

The The Basic System: Sci-Fi PDF tells us that a generic starship has a Maneuver rating of –2, can carry up to 800 passengers, travels at an average speed of 2500 miles per second, has an AC of 70 and has a Body of 70,000, but it lacks many details about customizing starships. The next few pages are an attempt at giving TBS GMs and Players ideas for customization without overwhelming them with monotonous stats contrary to the spirit of TBS.

115495.name: The Basic System: Cosmic
115495.description:
From Introduction:

The cosmic superhero. One of the greatest concepts in comic books. Sky soaring loners who travel from planet to planet playing hero to some pathetic race. We’ve introduced you to ‘superhero’ gaming in Guardian Universe Kamikaze Edition. Now we want to let you jump up and into the world of the ‘Cosmic Hero.’ What is a Cosmic Hero? He or she is someone with great powers. Able to travel in space and is empowered by the cosmic energies that flow through our universe and beyond.

115496.description: This is two-player game that simulates the Battle of Yangxia after Wuchang Uprising during the Xinhai Revolution of 1911. Gaming period is more than 40 days from late October to December 1. Gaming map covers three towns of Wuhan (Wuchang, Hankou and Hanyang). One player commands Revolutionary Army and the other player commands Qing Forces.
115496.name: The 1911 Revolution of China

115497.name: The Basic System: Magic
115497.description:
From Introduction:

Magic has got to be one of the greatest unknowns in any game. There are so many different ways to approach it that I’m sure it’d be hard to please everyone. So we have included a spell list in here for you. To determine how many Magic Points (MP) a player gets we just simply multiply their INT MSB times 5. This determines how many MP a player receives at the start of character creation. While you say “Wait a sec, magic uses WILL” it requires smarts to learn it.

115498.name: The Basic System: Mecha
115498.description:
From Introduction:

What are mecha? We see them constantly in anime and Manga. Giant machines piloted by kids and jet jockeys. They glorify the wars that are fought in their genre. So how does one create a mecha for The Basic System? This PDF is meant to offer a way for TBS fans to create their Mecha for whatever game they want. There is no setting provided in this text. This is a stripped down mecha creation system.

115499.name: Super Powers
115499.description:
From Introduction:

You use Power Points or PP to buy powers. Power Points are determined by multiplying your END MSB times ten (END MSB x10). So if a player has a PP of 50, they may spend 50 points to buy powers. It is up to the GM to regulate how powerful your players are. If you don’t want them buying a Cosmic power, make sure you make it clear at the beginning of the character creation process. Below is a list of powers Important: Powers are used like skills for the most part. So I someone has a Fire attack they would follow this formula: AGI MSB +Power Level +1d20 You are going to find powers that don’t have details for anything above level 10. You may still buy additional levels.

115500.name: High Velocity Duelling (Issue 1.04)
115500.description:
User Summary

In this issue: News, HVD, ADQ, AADA Chapters, Other CW Pages, Sand Duelling Errata, & Car Wars in White Dwarf.
